commit_message:
Remove unused methods from Ceph Backup driver

_connect_to_rados and _disconnect_from_rados were copied from the volume
driver and are not used for backups.

Change-Id: I0a3a38646447748ec5c4de95b297a53602f48090

The patch adds the notification support and introduces a poll
mechanism to check the migration progress.

* For the generic host based migration, the position indication of
/proc/<PID>/fdinfo/1 can be retrieved to indicate how many bytes
have been copied. LVM is taken as the reference to implement.

* For the driver specific migration, the back-end driver needs to
report a capability telling the manager if it supports to report the
migration progress. Please implement the method get_migration_progress
for your driver and add a stat flag migration_progress_report,
if your driver supports the progress report. Storwize is taken as the
reference to implement.

* For the file based migration, the voluem trasfer is implemented
in Patch Iece2776fa751152f97b389ddab426e50c6f79bea for the
RBD driver. The transfer percentage is calculated by the
relative position of the file handler over the volume size.

The migration progress can be checked via the cinderclient, and the
progress information can be found in the c-vol log, where the source
volume is located. The information is logged as
"The source volume XXXX has been copied ### percent".

Partial-implements: blueprint migration-improvement
'}]
commit_message:
Adds the migration progress support for migration

The patch adds the notification support and introduces a poll
mechanism to check the migration progress.

* For the generic host based migration, the position indication of
/proc/<PID>/fdinfo/1 can be retrieved to indicate how many bytes
have been copied. LVM is taken as the reference to implement.

* For the driver specific migration, the back-end driver needs to
report a capability telling the manager if it supports to report the
migration progress. Please implement the method get_migration_progress
for your driver and add a stat flag migration_progress_report,
if your driver supports the progress report. Storwize is taken as the
reference to implement.

* For the file based migration, the voluem trasfer is implemented
in Patch Iece2776fa751152f97b389ddab426e50c6f79bea for the
RBD driver. The transfer percentage is calculated by the
relative position of the file handler over the volume size.

The migration progress can be checked via the cinderclient, and the
progress information can be found in the c-vol log, where the source
volume is located. The information is logged as
"The source volume XXXX has been copied ### percent".

Change-Id: Ic156b6844cb82c0d8f70af8c6199c513644b82a0
Partial-implements: blueprint migration-improvement

If the admin is migrating a volume without locking the volume,
this migration can be aborted by the volume user's actions, e.g.

commit_message:
Adds migration abortion for available volumes

If the admin is migrating a volume without locking the volume,
this migration can be aborted by the volume user's actions, e.g.
extend, attach, delete, etc. This patch targets to abort the
host assisted migration across different volume nodes.

Change-Id: Iffc5bc28683c736239d707b2e4e7c6d6c3516cc6
Partial-implements: blueprint migration-improvement

commit_message:
Delete the deprecated sizelimit middleware

As it's TODO says,the content in this middleware can been replaced with
the same content in the oslo.middleware in Ocata,so we can delete them
and use them from the oslo.middleware directly.

Change-Id: Ide672ad0ba58c57dfd2120249ff395f57f77d5d9

subject: Instance name index had be repeated if instance name was not given when PXC cluster grow
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 9782, 'name': 'Morgan Jones', 'email': 'morgan@tesora.com', 'username': 'vgnbkr'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 14576, 'name': 'Petr Malik', 'email': 'pmalik@tesora.com', 'username': 'pmalik'}, {'_account_id': 15321, 'name': 'Matthew Van Dijk', 'email': 'mvandijk@tesora.com', 'username': 'mvandijk'}, {'_account_id': 18627, 'name': 'yuanpeng', 'email': 'ypnuaa037@126.com', 'username': 'yuanpeng'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-27 08:29:06.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/strategies/cluster/experimental/galera_common/api.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/cluster/test_galera_cluster.py'], 'message': 'Instance name index had be repeated if instance name was not given when PXC cluster grow

Name index of new instances start from 1 when PXC cluster grow, which causes user experience not good enough.
Duplicate names may cause the user confusion when shrinking cluster.
This change will guarantee the uniqueness of name-index made by trove

Change-Id: I1668c5d1842777d42f2cbf4f2917b8f190da9d82
Closes-Bug: #1636387
'}]
commit_message:
Instance name index had be repeated if instance name was not given when PXC cluster grow

Name index of new instances start from 1 when PXC cluster grow, which causes user experience not good enough.
Duplicate names may cause the user confusion when shrinking cluster.
This change will guarantee the uniqueness of name-index made by trove

Change-Id: I1668c5d1842777d42f2cbf4f2917b8f190da9d82
Closes-Bug: #1636387

commit_message:
Remove deprecated/obsolete ldap options

The devstack ldap configuration for keystone is still using some
old options that are no longer valid. The write support is
being removed this release. And in previous releases, the ldap
assignment driver support was removed and was not removed here.

Change-Id: I538626b681eaee6a7ac10dfbc29605b73fbe13bf

subject: Fix endpoint_type and OS_INTERFACE handling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-27 00:19:07.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_shade.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Fix endpoint_type and OS_INTERFACE handling

Currently, when calling `create_project` or other keystone-related
methods, shade always tries to contact the keystone's admin endpoint,
regardless of the value passed as the `endpoint_type` keyword argument
to the OpenStackCloud constructor and regardless of the `OS_INTERFACE`
environment variable.

This fix makes shade to behave like the openstackclient CLI, which gets
the interface setting from the config object, then passes it to the
client's constructor.

Change-Id: I12a3f0c631a97c73d918d4bf12865ad8be3f3a07
"}]
commit_message:
Fix endpoint_type and OS_INTERFACE handling

Currently, when calling `create_project` or other keystone-related
methods, shade always tries to contact the keystone's admin endpoint,
regardless of the value passed as the `endpoint_type` keyword argument
to the OpenStackCloud constructor and regardless of the `OS_INTERFACE`
environment variable.

This fix makes shade to behave like the openstackclient CLI, which gets
the interface setting from the config object, then passes it to the
client's constructor.

Change-Id: I12a3f0c631a97c73d918d4bf12865ad8be3f3a07

commit_message:
Refactor the usage of save_and_reraise_exception

Instead assigning the reraise flag as False in the exception
context, we'd better set it to False initially while
calling the save_and_reraise_exception().

Change-Id: I9e49c36003256ab77f2635a1c41d2cc2ebc84814

commit_message:
[WIP] Initial playbook for zuul-worker

Here we are replacing our zuul DIB elements, with ansible playbooks.
The playbooks will:

  - install pip
  - install virtualenv
  - create zuul user / group
  - create /home/zuul
  - install zuul into /opt/venv/zuul
  - install ssh
  - add ssh public key for zuul
  - add ssh public key for zuul to authorized_keys
  - add zuul user to sudoers

Change-Id: I1560547813d5f1018fdfa96baf79e9bed326ca20
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
New SSL certificates

Current SSL certificates have expired. This patch contain new ones
valid for 10 years and i've updated the ssl-ipv*.conf with the command
to create certificates with this expiration time.

Change-Id: Iaf4164149e3e28de8cf0367bc98e3e649bd10f87
(cherry picked from commit 8df7e460e7f8e30f5093dfdc26979f5431d56b30)

commit_message:
New SSL certificates

Current SSL certificates have expired. This patch contain new ones
valid for 10 years and i've updated the ssl-ipv*.conf with the command
to create certificates with this expiration time.

Change-Id: Iaf4164149e3e28de8cf0367bc98e3e649bd10f87
(cherry picked from commit 8df7e460e7f8e30f5093dfdc26979f5431d56b30)

commit_message:
New SSL certificates

Current SSL certificates have expired. This patch contain new ones
valid for 10 years and i've updated the ssl-ipv*.conf with the command
to create certificates with this expiration time.

Change-Id: Iaf4164149e3e28de8cf0367bc98e3e649bd10f87

commit_message:
HNAS: Add support for consistency groups in iSCSI driver

Added support for consistency groups in HNAS iSCSI driver.
update_consistencygroup is not implemented in this patch.

Co-Authored-By: Adriano Rosso <adriano.rosso@fit-tecnologia.org.br>

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint hnas-iscsi-consistency-group-support
Depends-On: I08175b031a65ea6ae5cec3c73d5312175f29c890

Change-Id: I7d01170fb6d36e794fbdc4c7684ad75b0a11fe3f

commit_message:
Handles missing key exception for encrypted volume

When deleting encryption key from key manager for encrypted volumes
the warning message is not printed with a proper message. This patch
will also handle the case of 404 with a more specific message.

Change-Id: Id4c68a5bdb82bcfe3430e3e11529c13095368b3e
Fixes-bug: #1631305

subject: Remove heat_stack_user from the deployer input
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-11 07:26:02.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'message': "Remove heat_stack_user from the deployer input

heat_stack_user role definitely does not have
enough permission to manage a heat stack and can't
be used in tempest, this is an internal role for heat.

We should use the same role for heat_stack_owner as
for a regular user.

This change also adds the role set for the regular users.
This role set also should enable volume backup usage,
so the swiftoperator role will be used.

Wouldn't be bad idea to rename the swiftoperator role
to something like 'user',
but it is out of scope for this change.

See also:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1314725
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1383369

Change-Id: If487dab0dc1d187ef0bacb9dbeae1186260ec975
"}]
commit_message:
Remove heat_stack_user from the deployer input

heat_stack_user role definitely does not have
enough permission to manage a heat stack and can't
be used in tempest, this is an internal role for heat.

We should use the same role for heat_stack_owner as
for a regular user.

This change also adds the role set for the regular users.
This role set also should enable volume backup usage,
so the swiftoperator role will be used.

Wouldn't be bad idea to rename the swiftoperator role
to something like 'user',
but it is out of scope for this change.

See also:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1314725
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1383369

Change-Id: If487dab0dc1d187ef0bacb9dbeae1186260ec975

commit_message:
Document new rst syntax for parser.

Updates rst syntax changes for the installation guides in specific but
could potentially also be followed by other guides providing BASH like
code.

- Documents parser related syntax changes.
- Updates current documentation for profiling (only blocks) and source
  code (code-blocks).

Change-Id: I831b79f01ea9b5c8fe9f7861887d2c14a9e213bc

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-30 12:49:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vif.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/live_migration.py'], 'message': 'WIP: Clean up of OVS port on source host post migration

After live migration of an instance, as part of the cleanup,
the deletion of port from OVS is not happening on source host.

With this fix, the OVS port is cleaned up as part of the

Closes-Bug: #1637551
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Clean up of OVS port on source host post migration

After live migration of an instance, as part of the cleanup,
the deletion of port from OVS is not happening on source host.

With this fix, the OVS port is cleaned up as part of the
post live migration on source.

Change-Id: I45ab99e02a5834d26b21ce3215c60048440b51a9
Closes-Bug: #1637551

Pecan does not currently use api paste to load middleware like the
legacy wsgi, so we need to explicitly import it and wrap the pecan app.
This is a follow-up to Ice9ee8f4e04050271d59858f92034c230325718b.

commit_message:
Pecan: add http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware

Pecan does not currently use api paste to load middleware like the
legacy wsgi, so we need to explicitly import it and wrap the pecan app.
This is a follow-up to Ice9ee8f4e04050271d59858f92034c230325718b.

Change-Id: I3e1b08bf1f902cf09c8a39699c00f1b0d22c3277
Closes-Bug: #1590608

commit_message:
lib/neutron: Remove remaining references to Q_ variables

Q_ variables belong to neutron-legacy.

These are True by default in neutron.
Remove them in favor of post-config meta section.

Change-Id: If691a79b09003f85a07c9f33e0379a2b21e48141

commit_message:
zabbix fixes and bug fixes

1. zabbix driver to user callback_on_fault
2. zabbix notifications to return none if
host is not mapped i.e. not known by vitrage
3. reduce rescheduler test time

Change-Id: I252e46fb87eb8631cf364ac98c9af98059ab1421

This change create common interface for command execution, it

Cinder utils execute will make decision based on config arg,

commit_message:
Switch to use execute from cinder utils

This change create common interface for command execution, it
will allow use only one approach at the same time.

Cinder utils execute will make decision based on config arg,
uses oslo putils or rootwrap daemon client via class helpers
(RootwrapProcessHelper and RootwrapDaemonHelper).

Change-Id: I3ef4508c12bd45404b8ec55c042071b2be287f04
Implements: blueprint rootwrap-daemon-mode

commit_message:
WIP: encrypted rbd support

Currently the rbd driver doesn't communicate to nova if a volume
is encrypted. It's expected that this patch blows up the nova tests.

Change-Id: I3b189f928f20ea32790556125c0e4facee28bfa5

commit_message:
Add get_trust_context method to BackupManager

This method allows the user to delegate trust to the cinder-backup
process to perform long-running operations on their behalf.

This avoids the situation where a particularly large backup or slow
network causes a backup process initiated by a user to take longer than
the configured token expiration time when it would fail.

WIP

Fixes: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1298135
Change-Id: I5a417efe8ab73fa755df2763034f39e0753bc1b7

Attempting to build images fails now with an error because of a change

commit_message:
Update the Signing Key for Percona Debian and Ubuntu Packages

Attempting to build images fails now with an error because of a change
in the signing key for Percona packages.

Quick summary copied from [1]

Percona .deb packages are signed with a key that uses an algorithm now
considered weak. Starting with the next release, Debian and Ubuntu
packages are signed with a new key that uses the much stronger SHA-512
algorithm. All future package release will also contain the new
algorithm.

It’s important that you add the new key before the next release.

See also [2] in trove.

[1] https://www.percona.com/blog/2016/10/13/new-signing-key-for-percona-debian-and-ubuntu-packages/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/390342/

Change-Id: I4ca5fccf51e51059d4035f7206609c8afa997c94

commit_message:
Update the Signing Key for Percona Debian and Ubuntu Packages

Attempting to build images fails now with an error because of a change
in the signing key for Percona packages.

Quick summary copied from [1]

Percona .deb packages are signed with a key that uses an algorithm now
considered weak. Starting with the next release, Debian and Ubuntu
packages are signed with a new key that uses the much stronger SHA-512
algorithm. All future package release will also contain the new
algorithm.

It’s important that you add the new key before the next release.

[1] https://www.percona.com/blog/2016/10/13/new-signing-key-for-percona-debian-and-ubuntu-packages/

Change-Id: I0420193982ebc5c9922eb388adb85da1423ab3f0

commit_message:
Include alembic migrations in module

Explicitly include all alembic data in installed python module,
ensuring that installations direct from git repositories are
fully functional when compared to use of sdist generated tarballs
from tarballs.openstack.org or pypi.

Change-Id: Ica6e8e84f5bb1638ad3e7042fac381aef2c14edf
Closes-Bug: 1574610

commit_message:
Remove o/c/local.py and o/c/log.py

Removing openstack/common from all OpenStack code in favor of the
Oslo libraries is a project wide goal for the Ocata release.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-07 13:42:36.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/emc/test_emc_vmax.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_masking.py'], 'message': 'VMAX driver - Create initiator group in single call

The VMAX driver created the initiator group first
and then added in the initiators one-by-one. This
potentially had a performance impact because there could
be a significant number of initiators. This fix creates
the initiator group, containing all the initiators, in a
single call.

Change-Id: Ib8a2ad067442d6eef06de6888e8787af8e5bd1fc
Closes-Bug: #1555728
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - Create initiator group in single call

The VMAX driver created the initiator group first
and then added in the initiators one-by-one. This
potentially had a performance impact because there could
be a significant number of initiators. This fix creates
the initiator group, containing all the initiators, in a
single call.

Change-Id: Ib8a2ad067442d6eef06de6888e8787af8e5bd1fc
Closes-Bug: #1555728

subject: We no longer need to copy old instack.qcow2 on image promote
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 19:02:54.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/mirror-server/promote.sh'], 'message': 'We no longer need to copy old instack.qcow2 on image promote

The instack.qcow2 we are copying has been broken for quite a while
and tripleo-quickstart implemented a feature to allow using the
overcloud-full.qcow2 as an undercloud image.

Change-Id: Ic55dd790adc0ed95b5b207bf3fb10913b4c3fed5
'}]
commit_message:
We no longer need to copy old instack.qcow2 on image promote

The instack.qcow2 we are copying has been broken for quite a while
and tripleo-quickstart implemented a feature to allow using the
overcloud-full.qcow2 as an undercloud image.

Change-Id: Ic55dd790adc0ed95b5b207bf3fb10913b4c3fed5

subject: Reset Cgsnapshot state
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-30 00:56:10.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/cgsnapshot-reset-state.rst'], 'message': "Reset Cgsnapshot state

Currently a user can create Cgsnapshot from a Consistency Group.
But there's no single API that allows a user to reset the state
of cgsnapshot.In this spec, we propose to provide a cgsnapshot
API that can be supported to reset cgsnapshot state.

Change-Id: I2103104663dfa2e37e75be004c979d19e78a6944
blueprint: cgsnapshot-reset-state
"}]
commit_message:
Reset Cgsnapshot state

Currently a user can create Cgsnapshot from a Consistency Group.
But there's no single API that allows a user to reset the state
of cgsnapshot.In this spec, we propose to provide a cgsnapshot
API that can be supported to reset cgsnapshot state.

Change-Id: I2103104663dfa2e37e75be004c979d19e78a6944
blueprint: cgsnapshot-reset-state

commit_message:
List backups return "parent_id" field

List backups(detail) or show backup return backup parent_id can make
the caller(user/operator) known the dependency relationship
between a volume's backups.

The parent_id also help horizon or other openstack portal
to draw the backups relationship graph.

change-ID: Iec6750241c8581f581a0c6eada55711d806d788d
Implements: blueprint list-backups-return-parent-id

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-26 03:24:26.000000000', 'files': ['tools/lintstack.py', 'tools/generate_driver_list.py'], 'message': 'Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

TrivialFix: Similar [1] in Kolla project
As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function. When they
are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the Python interpreter.
Therefore, when using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
may be more readable and reasonable.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/349353/

Change-Id: I264bbb9a8cb35d970c66bcb1fd94b65ece9cc752
'}]
commit_message:
Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

TrivialFix: Similar [1] in Kolla project
As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function. When they
are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the Python interpreter.
Therefore, when using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
may be more readable and reasonable.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/349353/

Change-Id: I264bbb9a8cb35d970c66bcb1fd94b65ece9cc752

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-03 05:02:09.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'Enable multipath flag for volume migration

Multipath settings are not taken into account when doing volume
migration. Multipath settings should be passed in to brick_get_
connector_properties.

Change-Id: If2716c69744ab2792e032cd355497f8d0d854ac7
Closes-Bug: #1603955
'}]
commit_message:
Enable multipath flag for volume migration

Multipath settings are not taken into account when doing volume
migration. Multipath settings should be passed in to brick_get_
connector_properties.

Change-Id: If2716c69744ab2792e032cd355497f8d0d854ac7
Closes-Bug: #1603955

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-25 06:22:58.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_hp3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/fake_hp_client_exceptions.py'], 'message': 'Handle snapshot delete conflict in 3par driver

Issue is most likely due to the fact that 3par uses online
copy during create from snapshot.   This process on the 3PAR
creates temporary snapshots for doing the copy.  They get
deleted after the online (background) copy is completed.
If user try and delete the volume during that process, user
will get an HTTP Conflict and the "volume has a child" error.

Fix is to detect conflict code and remove temporary online
copies if they exist and delete snapshot again.

Modified unit test to check HTTP conflict with error code

Closes-Bug: #1600104
(cherry picked from commit 1e8204795e240303795d49d8268233220c9455eb)

In addition: fake_hp_client_exceptions.py file changed

Change-Id: If4a2cabb7afd0299c78e42a941b95a01c76b2b5b
'}]
commit_message:
Handle snapshot delete conflict in 3par driver

Issue is most likely due to the fact that 3par uses online
copy during create from snapshot.   This process on the 3PAR
creates temporary snapshots for doing the copy.  They get
deleted after the online (background) copy is completed.
If user try and delete the volume during that process, user
will get an HTTP Conflict and the "volume has a child" error.

Fix is to detect conflict code and remove temporary online
copies if they exist and delete snapshot again.

Modified unit test to check HTTP conflict with error code

Closes-Bug: #1600104
(cherry picked from commit 1e8204795e240303795d49d8268233220c9455eb)

In addition: fake_hp_client_exceptions.py file changed

Change-Id: If4a2cabb7afd0299c78e42a941b95a01c76b2b5b

commit_message:
Show user_id when cinder snapshot-show

The user_id attribute should be show for end user or other
project(eg:ceilometer, cloudkitty). And it should consistent
with other cinder command to be showed.

Change-Id: I1002e8625f8c8884c8317de37d2c66b11ff9b7dd
Closes-Bug: #1614095

commit_message:
Add MacroSAN cinder driver

This driver supports below features:
* Volume Create/Delete
* Volume Attach/Detach
* Snapshot Create/Delete
* Create Volume from Snapshot
* Copy Image to Volume
* Copy Volume to Image
* Clone Volume
* Extend volume
* Volume Migration

This patchset includes the unit tests.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint macrosan-driver-cinder

Change-Id: I963de9efd8b34782669e275fd65355b5e44f7df9

Closes-Bug: #1630035
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for Tegile driver failing to establish volume connection

LUN number reported should be integer, but it is returned
as a string by the backend storage. This change would help
handle the case.

Change-Id: I600cb94d646fabbb053f390dd9b3db489ebedfc8
Closes-Bug: #1630035

subject: Enable release notes translation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-06 18:26:31.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: I563338895fe40902c1f05e86ab1aa3d0bc618094
"}]
commit_message:
Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: I563338895fe40902c1f05e86ab1aa3d0bc618094

subject: Wait for VirtualBox share to become available
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-29 21:43:31.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/scripts/osbash/template-osbashauto'], 'message': 'Wait for VirtualBox share to become available

If we try to mount to the VirtualBox shared directory before it becomes
available, we get an error back and the installation aborts.

This patches fixes this race by making osbashauto try to mount the
share until it succeeds.

The patch also saves a log file to track the results.

Change-Id: Ic145aa7513292a88a9591955863a6b9bdcba866d
(cherry picked from commit e229aea8abf35c2db119c21718d4064feb8390a0)
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for VirtualBox share to become available

If we try to mount to the VirtualBox shared directory before it becomes
available, we get an error back and the installation aborts.

This patches fixes this race by making osbashauto try to mount the
share until it succeeds.

The patch also saves a log file to track the results.

Change-Id: Ic145aa7513292a88a9591955863a6b9bdcba866d
(cherry picked from commit e229aea8abf35c2db119c21718d4064feb8390a0)

Cruz', 'email': 'erlon.rodrigues.cruz@canonical.com', 'username': 'sombrafam'}, {'_account_id': 21428, 'name': 'JiWei', 'email': '17366060309@163.com', 'username': 'WeiJi'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-17 15:02:30.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/initiator/connectors/iscsi.py'], 'message': "Add retries to iSCSI connect_volume

It's possible for Nova and Cinder to both call in to os-brick
to have a connect and disconnect overlap. These methods have
locking around them to prevent clashes, but in this case each
service's locks could be in a separate directory and still end
up clashing.

Since initial volume connect does not have IO running yet, we
can just handle the case where the connection gets yanked out
from under us by retrying the connect again.

Change-Id: Ic14e442c656b81c17a983166b27c996fa1aa8b83
"}]
commit_message:
Add retries to iSCSI connect_volume

It's possible for Nova and Cinder to both call in to os-brick
to have a connect and disconnect overlap. These methods have
locking around them to prevent clashes, but in this case each
service's locks could be in a separate directory and still end
up clashing.

Since initial volume connect does not have IO running yet, we
can just handle the case where the connection gets yanked out
from under us by retrying the connect again.

Change-Id: Ic14e442c656b81c17a983166b27c996fa1aa8b83

commit_message:
Use is_scheduler_filter_enabled for ServerGroupAffinityFilter

If ServerGroupAffinityFilter is missing in nova.conf: DEFAULT.
scheduler_default_filters, test_create_server_with_scheduler_hint_group
should be skipped, otherwise it will get a server BuildErrorException.

Change-Id: I353cd421790bbebe88e102f74316a5235fd1ed74
Closes-Bug: #1637053

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Barbican.
The purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL
correctly in case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer
such as HAProxy) in front of Barbican.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled
via a configuration value.

Change-Id: Iad0151ca41684fa2d8eb60c343028e13c3719e66
Closes-bug: #1590608
'}]
commit_message:
Use http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Barbican.
The purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL
correctly in case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer
such as HAProxy) in front of Barbican.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled
via a configuration value.

Change-Id: Iad0151ca41684fa2d8eb60c343028e13c3719e66
Closes-bug: #1590608

commit_message:
DotHill: resize volume if cloned image is larger

Extend volume if during create_volume_from_snapshot() the new volume
is larger than the image it was cloned from. Extended test case to
cover the change.

Closes-Bug: #1554770

Change-Id: If8a1298aa45b95c10e5de34720fac3cfb3d56d4f
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>

subject: Change import statement to not rename the module
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-28 14:59:44.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/tests/unit/ml2/test_mechanism_odl.py'], 'message': 'Change import statement to not rename the module

Importing "config" then renaming it to "config" is duplicative.

Renaming it to ml2_config as some other drivers do[1], could be done but
it would cause a lot of whitespace changes to make pep8 happy.

[1]: http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=neutron.plugins.ml2%20import%20config&i=nope&files=&repos=

Change-Id: I0e7b2ddf7140b949644ba34c2081a9e4bcf61a30
'}]
commit_message:
Change import statement to not rename the module

Importing "config" then renaming it to "config" is duplicative.

Renaming it to ml2_config as some other drivers do[1], could be done but
it would cause a lot of whitespace changes to make pep8 happy.

[1]: http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=neutron.plugins.ml2%20import%20config&i=nope&files=&repos=

Change-Id: I0e7b2ddf7140b949644ba34c2081a9e4bcf61a30

commit_message:
Make neutron-fwaas tempest jobs for legacy and v1 voting

The neutron-fwaas tempest jobs that are based on the fwaas v1 tempest
tests have shown a record of stability.  This change makes them voting.

Change-Id: I845bbdb000fff120b358eea6d4de2f93bc0bfd0b

commit_message:
Use global defaults for common job parameters

0-diff change moving default values from project definitions to global
defaults.

 -- tarball-site
 -- doc-publisher-site
 -- branch-override
 -- job-suffix
 -- network
 -- special
 -- suffix

Change-Id: I044d46422c3ef1288b5c6ea0ffd7921b22ba1d00

commit_message:
Remove validate_auth_ksc

This was a workaround for python-openstackclient back when it was still
dependent on keystoneclient. OSC has its own workaround now, so this
should no longer be needed.

commit_message:
Fix warning when running tox -e docs

WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
  cmd: /bin/rm
  env: /openstack/barbican/.tox/docs
Maybe you forgot to specify a dependency? See also the
whitelist_externals envconfig setting.

subject: Replace 'MagicMock' with 'Mock'
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-10-29 03:53:28.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py'], 'message': "Replace 'MagicMock' with 'Mock'

Mock allows you to assign functions (or the other Mock instances)
to magic methods and they will be called appropriately. The MagicMock
class is just a Mock variant that has all of the magic methods
pre-created for you (well, all the useful ones anyway).[1]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.mock.html
related-bug: 1475722

Change-Id: If51481c110f9c8b9f1daafcf207574056b1b3f70
"}]
commit_message:
Replace 'MagicMock' with 'Mock'

Mock allows you to assign functions (or the other Mock instances)
to magic methods and they will be called appropriately. The MagicMock
class is just a Mock variant that has all of the magic methods
pre-created for you (well, all the useful ones anyway).[1]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.mock.html
related-bug: 1475722

Change-Id: If51481c110f9c8b9f1daafcf207574056b1b3f70

commit_message:
Introduced payload and template downloading

Syntribos now downloads payloads as part of the initialization process, and
also can download payloads and templates as part of the 'syntribos download'
command.

Change-Id: I17501535e5fd341c2705e07e3797643dc2d4a7df

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-10-25 13:56:00.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/files/monasca-transform/monasca-transform_mysql.sql', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/README.md', 'tools/vagrant/local.conf'], 'message': 'Use database password from variable

There is a variable that tells what is the database (mysql)
password. However plugin.sh is using a hardcoded password.
Commits provides using DATABASE_PASSWORD variable (the same
one as devstack is using) + defines a variable for m-transform
user - MONASCA_TRANSFORM_DB_PASSWORD

Change-Id: I9fc8296ef31b22564f2cf1536e51ab3abc8c9dc9
'}]
commit_message:
Use database password from variable

There is a variable that tells what is the database (mysql)
password. However plugin.sh is using a hardcoded password.
Commits provides using DATABASE_PASSWORD variable (the same
one as devstack is using) + defines a variable for m-transform
user - MONASCA_TRANSFORM_DB_PASSWORD

Change-Id: I9fc8296ef31b22564f2cf1536e51ab3abc8c9dc9

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-09-12 17:13:08.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'WIP: Adds ironic v3 only job

Creates a job to run ironic in a v3 only environment, by setting
the devstack local.conf property "ENABLE_IDENTITY_V2=False" in
such job, and enables it as non-voting.
This job is a copy of the stable tempest-dsvm-ironic-agent_ssh
ironic job. This is part of the effort to encourage the v3 identity
v3 API usage. It runs the non-voting identity v3 only job
against ironic to ensure it can work without the keystone v2 api.

Change-Id: I8aa9a8953a27b0c7e0a17e3e1b9fe80a0f8a6861
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Adds ironic v3 only job

Creates a job to run ironic in a v3 only environment, by setting
the devstack local.conf property "ENABLE_IDENTITY_V2=False" in
such job, and enables it as non-voting.
This job is a copy of the stable tempest-dsvm-ironic-agent_ssh
ironic job. This is part of the effort to encourage the v3 identity
v3 API usage. It runs the non-voting identity v3 only job
against ironic to ensure it can work without the keystone v2 api.

Change-Id: I8aa9a8953a27b0c7e0a17e3e1b9fe80a0f8a6861

subject: Introduce Plugin Directory for Neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-10-28 07:57:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/tests/_base.py', 'neutron_lib/plugins/__init__.py', 'neutron_lib/plugins/directory.py', 'requirements.txt', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/plugins/__init__.py', 'neutron_lib/constants.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/plugins/test_directory.py'], 'message': 'Introduce Plugin Directory for Neutron

The NeutronManager is heavily relied on across Neutron projects
primarily to look up plugins at runtime. During the init phase
however, the Manager lays down all sorts of plumbing needed for
other core objectives. Rehoming it as is would be not only
impossible, but also perpetrating the bad pattern where the
class itself holds too many responsibilities.

This patch extract the part whose responsibility is the mapping
between aliases and plugins. The NeutronManager will then make
use of this registry to store the plugin mapping, and subprojects
will stop using the manager in favor of the newly introduced
plugin directory.

Partially-implement: blueprint neutron-lib

Change-Id: I83b0217ea16d2c3f4ada05686c50470e50bd5208
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce Plugin Directory for Neutron

The NeutronManager is heavily relied on across Neutron projects
primarily to look up plugins at runtime. During the init phase
however, the Manager lays down all sorts of plumbing needed for
other core objectives. Rehoming it as is would be not only
impossible, but also perpetrating the bad pattern where the
class itself holds too many responsibilities.

This patch extract the part whose responsibility is the mapping
between aliases and plugins. The NeutronManager will then make
use of this registry to store the plugin mapping, and subprojects
will stop using the manager in favor of the newly introduced
plugin directory.

Partially-implement: blueprint neutron-lib

Change-Id: I83b0217ea16d2c3f4ada05686c50470e50bd5208

Closes-Bug: #1634195

commit_message:
[WIP]Adds retry to plan workflows

This patch adds retry count and delay to each of the actions that
interact with swift during plan creation.

Other options considered:
 - utilizing parameters in client constructor for swift
 - adding arguments to TripleOAction constructor and wrapping all
   potentially contentious blocks with a while loop with a try/except

Change-Id: Id9c7c98433118acb5e93edf4f6612a312c6fbfac
Closes-Bug: #1634195

Implement Nova rescue/unrescue in Ironic. Also implement an extension in
IPA that carries out rescue-related tasks. After rescuing a node, it
will be left running a rescue ramdisk, configured with the
rescue_password, and listening with ssh on the specified network

Partial-bug; 1526449
Change-Id: Idc05cf7a9c6c1968e1403fc97bde3713d2e7e3f6
Co-authored-by: Alex Weeks <alex.weeks@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Implement rescue mode

Implement Nova rescue/unrescue in Ironic. Also implement an extension in
IPA that carries out rescue-related tasks. After rescuing a node, it
will be left running a rescue ramdisk, configured with the
rescue_password, and listening with ssh on the specified network
interfaces.

Partial-bug; 1526449
Change-Id: Idc05cf7a9c6c1968e1403fc97bde3713d2e7e3f6
Co-authored-by: Alex Weeks <alex.weeks@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Document Neutron subnet pools

Subnet Pools are not a new feature.  It has been available since Kilo.
However, it is under-documented (API docs only).  It is a neat and
simple feature that people are likely to find useful.

Change-Id: I0fa6cc81a1ff558dad7e5d9afb6da8c69ec64b9c

subject: Low-level API: Don't log just before raising an exception
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-28 15:37:26.000000000', 'files': ['swiftclient/client.py'], 'message': "Low-level API: Don't log just before raising an exception

The only logging we should do is when we've encountered a problem *and
we've dealt with it ourselves*. When we're raising an exception, it
should be up to the caller to decide whether to log anything about it.

Anything else is just rude.

Change-Id: I1c96b76d90a78b7a10ffe63e4a7440c8f579147c
Closes-Bug:  1213179
Related-Bug: 1202229
"}]
commit_message:
Low-level API: Don't log just before raising an exception

The only logging we should do is when we've encountered a problem *and
we've dealt with it ourselves*. When we're raising an exception, it
should be up to the caller to decide whether to log anything about it.

Anything else is just rude.

Change-Id: I1c96b76d90a78b7a10ffe63e4a7440c8f579147c
Closes-Bug:  1213179
Related-Bug: 1202229

commit_message:
Deactivate LVM before write image to disk

If image is based on LVM and existing LVM is active, new volumes
will be messed up by the old ones during rebuild, unless the system
is rebooted. LVM operations which need to be done before reboot
will fail.

Closes-Bug: #1612462

Change-Id: I82ea1d688b20dcbef3b9238067673d1795fd4ad7

commit_message:
Fix for allowing user to create zone other than ending with TLD

In a setup in which there are more than one designate-centeral
and designate-api servers , current check to enforce zone names
ending with TLD does not work . This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Ie6161b48ed7146587aabc8666a37ca9276502988
Closes-Bug: #1628787

subject: Fix permissions for the Nova lock directory in systemd
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-28 13:22:46.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_pre_install.yml', 'templates/nova-systemd-tempfiles.j2', 'templates/nova.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fix permissions for the Nova lock directory in systemd

The directory set as `lock_path` in `nova.conf` must be created with
the nova system user as its owner, otherwise the VIF plugin would fail
to acquire a lock when launching an instance.

Here we set up systemd to create this directory with correct owner and
permissions, besides moving its path to a `nova_lock_path` variable.

Apparently, the `/var/lock/{{ item.value.service_name }}` directory,
which is also created by `nova-systemd-tempfiles.j2`, is not needed at
all. But as this patch is intended to be backported to a stable release,
we keep it by now to avoid any unforeseen issues.

Change-Id: I9886778eddc23f0f71dfdfc87f4f715054946b3d
Closes-Bug: #1636604
(cherry picked from commit 1d4c3ad6ece7648d7329c5a6bfd42ed9b53b3022)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix permissions for the Nova lock directory in systemd

The directory set as `lock_path` in `nova.conf` must be created with
the nova system user as its owner, otherwise the VIF plugin would fail
to acquire a lock when launching an instance.

Here we set up systemd to create this directory with correct owner and
permissions, besides moving its path to a `nova_lock_path` variable.

Apparently, the `/var/lock/{{ item.value.service_name }}` directory,
which is also created by `nova-systemd-tempfiles.j2`, is not needed at
all. But as this patch is intended to be backported to a stable release,
we keep it by now to avoid any unforeseen issues.

Change-Id: I9886778eddc23f0f71dfdfc87f4f715054946b3d
Closes-Bug: #1636604
(cherry picked from commit 1d4c3ad6ece7648d7329c5a6bfd42ed9b53b3022)

commit_message:
Add object-reconstructor for swift EC

Swift Erasure Coding requires the object-reconstructor to be running,
this PR adds the object-reconstructor configuration and systemd/upstart
file.

Additionally, this PR adds testing for an erasure-coding policy as well
as for multiple policies in 1 deployment.

Change-Id: I71fe3d77e93112b9d27c93b37b59e6242cb3e00e
Closes-Bug: #1634859

that will execute the much quicker and insecure wipefs instead

commit_message:
Support use_insecure_erase_with_wipefs option

Add a new configuration parameter under deploy in ironic.conf
that will execute the much quicker and insecure wipefs instead
of the slower and secure hdparm.

This is for scenarios where machines have many large disk drives
and only run internal tests.

Change-Id: I98a5070d449775bc89252c0858e9e1a0cabd52bd

commit_message:
Support use_insecure_erase_with_wipefs option

Add a new configuration parameter under deploy in ironic.conf
that will execute the much quicker and insecure wipefs instead
of the slower and secure hdparm.

This is for scenarios where machines have many large disk drives
and only run internal tests.

Change-Id: If7093b09bde1b4be8f6ef251f167e321210ad3b5
Depends-On: 347515

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-10-06 18:14:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_claims.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/claims.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': "Fix drop_move_claim() on revert resize

On revert_resize(), the migration context was dropped hence setting it
to None.  The problem is that the migration context is needed when
executing finish_revert_resize() so that the neutron port can be updated
with the right binding profile.

This patch moves the instance.drop_migration_context() call out from the
resource tracker so that the migration context can be dropped at the
appropriate times: after RT.drop_move_claim() is called in the compute
manager's confirm_resize() call and after the virt driver's
finish_revert_resize() in the compute manager's finish_revert_resize()
call.

Change-Id: I1b7b2573de4380576dd8b801ed59d8955b0ab72a
Partial-bug: #1512880
"}]
commit_message:
Fix drop_move_claim() on revert resize

On revert_resize(), the migration context was dropped hence setting it
to None.  The problem is that the migration context is needed when
executing finish_revert_resize() so that the neutron port can be updated
with the right binding profile.

This patch moves the instance.drop_migration_context() call out from the
resource tracker so that the migration context can be dropped at the
appropriate times: after RT.drop_move_claim() is called in the compute
manager's confirm_resize() call and after the virt driver's
finish_revert_resize() in the compute manager's finish_revert_resize()
call.

Change-Id: I1b7b2573de4380576dd8b801ed59d8955b0ab72a
Partial-bug: #1512880

When deleting a claimed message, Zaqar v2 API requires client to
specify the claim_id as query parameter. However, this is not
RESTful. So this patch tries to address this issue by rebuilding

Change-Id: I614014373c8fb14e13ff1f00837ea36c41c3fe2e
"}]
commit_message:
Support to delete claimed message

When deleting a claimed message, Zaqar v2 API requires client to
specify the claim_id as query parameter. However, this is not
RESTful. So this patch tries to address this issue by rebuilding
request URI only for deleting claimed message operation rather than
supporting query parameter for all resources' deleting operation.

Change-Id: I614014373c8fb14e13ff1f00837ea36c41c3fe2e

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 16:55:01.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "networking-bgpvpn: remove check-requirements jobs

As a follow up to I21c8aadd82249882243bf8e23b37e23fcb62f507,
and after an IRC discussion with the infra team [1], there seems
to be an agreement that simply removing the check-requirements
job from networking-bgpvpn is the best *temporarily* solution,

We plan to add automated requirements checks when it will be clear

Depends-On: Ibc3fb11598298938bc72be2ce8fc12d5e231b6bc
"}]
commit_message:
networking-bgpvpn: remove check-requirements jobs

As a follow up to I21c8aadd82249882243bf8e23b37e23fcb62f507,
and after an IRC discussion with the infra team [1], there seems
to be an agreement that simply removing the check-requirements
job from networking-bgpvpn is the best *temporarily* solution,
until a decision is made on how a project like ours should work
in branches.

We plan to add automated requirements checks when it will be clear
how to do it in our different branches.

This change is dependent on Ibc3fb11598298938bc72be2ce8fc12d5e231b6bc
to guarantee that we won't propagate bogus requirements in global
requirements.

Also related: email thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/079773.html

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2015-11-24.log.html#t2015-11-24T16:03:50

Change-Id: I60df289591a11b53de5f15835137892e32873b15
Depends-On: Ibc3fb11598298938bc72be2ce8fc12d5e231b6bc

subject: Record the open question around resource audits
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-01 15:36:27.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/resource-providers.rst'], 'message': "Record the open question around resource audits

When using the inventory table, it is likely to grow very large.
Where possible, we should avoid having an extra migration soon after
introducing the table, due to how expensive that migration will be.

We need a way to check the IP allocations are in sync with neutron's
view of its IP capacity. This is being discussed in various specs
including the generic-resource-pools spec and the routed networks spec.

Change-Id: I97856cbc628e05abe50b09915b6e03f74b328c96
"}]
commit_message:
Record the open question around resource audits

When using the inventory table, it is likely to grow very large.
Where possible, we should avoid having an extra migration soon after
introducing the table, due to how expensive that migration will be.

We need a way to check the IP allocations are in sync with neutron's
view of its IP capacity. This is being discussed in various specs
including the generic-resource-pools spec and the routed networks spec.

Change-Id: I97856cbc628e05abe50b09915b6e03f74b328c96

This blueprint/spec proposes replacing the server groups API extension
with an entirely different, simpler, and more flexible system for
infoming the Nova scheduler about placement preferences at the time

Change-Id: I9a35eb9d13123bb7f020c382f6b402e91a08de31

commit_message:
Add generic scheduling/placement API

This blueprint/spec proposes replacing the server groups API extension
with an entirely different, simpler, and more flexible system for
infoming the Nova scheduler about placement preferences at the time
of launch, including "soft" scheduling and proximate-distance placement.

Change-Id: I9a35eb9d13123bb7f020c382f6b402e91a08de31
Blueprint: generic-scheduling-policies

commit_message:
alembic: db migration fails

commit_message:
libvirt: Separate functions to get root, ephemeral, and swap

Move the creation of the root disk, ephemeral disks, and the swap disk
from _create_image into separate functions. This directly makes
_create_image more readable, but the primary purpose is to support
subsequent change Ia085e218, which iterates over disks in
finish_migration without creating them.

We refactor the test_create_image_* tests which exclusively tested
epehemeral disk creation to instead test _get_ephemeral_disks, and add
some additional tests for ephemeral disks created from block device
mappings.

Change-Id: If2fcc97928607189446e067886f70786bcc1cb3f

commit_message:
libvirt: Add DiskFromImage and DiskFromFunc

This change adds an interface to backend which allows us to specify
how a disk is created, but defer the actual creation. This allows us
to implement a generic method to iterate over disks, and allow the
caller to determine whether they should be created or not. This allows
us to resize and check, but not create, in finish_migration whilst
still re-using the disk iteration logic currently in _create_image.

We don't address callers in _create_images_and_backing yet, but these
will be addressed.

Note that changes to tests are deliberately minimal, so that we
continue to validate the code is calling down to cache() as before.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage

Change-Id: I099a0b372ef4801bd8a81561dc9d69a472bc2d91

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-08-01 15:45:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Add _create_external_boot_disks

This replaces the manual creation of external boot disks in
_create_image, as well as calls to _fetch_instance_kernel_ramdisk. The
latter function is removed, as well as _try_fetch_image because
_fetch_instance_kernel_ramdisk was its last caller.

As seen in test changes, this introduces a minor change in behaviour.
Previously, _fetch_instance_kernel_ramdisk would download directly to
the instance directory. We now use the image cache, as for all other
image downloads.

Change-Id: If460496f4466acc1a019f571b2245de07413ca2a
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Add _create_external_boot_disks

This replaces the manual creation of external boot disks in
_create_image, as well as calls to _fetch_instance_kernel_ramdisk. The
latter function is removed, as well as _try_fetch_image because
_fetch_instance_kernel_ramdisk was its last caller.

As seen in test changes, this introduces a minor change in behaviour.
Previously, _fetch_instance_kernel_ramdisk would download directly to
the instance directory. We now use the image cache, as for all other
image downloads.

Change-Id: If460496f4466acc1a019f571b2245de07413ca2a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 12:51:12.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/config-guest-nic-pci-address.rst'], 'message': "Configurable guest's NIC PCI address

A user can specify to launch a guest with multiple virtual NICs but in the
guest it's not trivial to correlate the NICs requested with the actual PCI
network devices created.  This blueprint addresses this limitation by enabling
the user to specify the PCI address of the virtual NICs to correlate them back

Change-Id: I298e1fb6f096e6256f34253953f41d42e8c6679d
Implements: blueprint config-guest-nic-pci-address
"}]
commit_message:
Configurable guest's NIC PCI address

A user can specify to launch a guest with multiple virtual NICs but in the
guest it's not trivial to correlate the NICs requested with the actual PCI
network devices created.  This blueprint addresses this limitation by enabling
the user to specify the PCI address of the virtual NICs to correlate them back
to the guest.

Change-Id: I298e1fb6f096e6256f34253953f41d42e8c6679d
Implements: blueprint config-guest-nic-pci-address

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-04 07:05:21.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/support-list-locked-instances.rst'], 'message': 'Support "locked" filter when list servers

After the implementation of

commit_message:
Support "locked" filter when list servers

After the implementation of
bp/add-locking-information-in-server-get-response

we now have locked information in the response data
of show method, but it is not good enough. As we may
have a large number of locked instances, it will take
forever to check the instances one by one, it will be
really useful if we can list all the locked instances
in one call.

This spec propose to add support for 'locked' filter for
List API.

APIImpact: "locked" filter will be added for "list" method

Change-Id: Ie970e7974ee268ab2366ebcc8cf0d4111dabc375
Blueprint: support-list-locked-instances

The Nova API always adds the 'default' security group to a server POST
response even if the Neutron network that the instance is using has port
security disabled. This is misleading. A better approach is to provide a
link to the os-security-groups API in the server POST response so the user
can get the security groups for the server after it's created.

Change-Id: Ie321d1d8bbc81fb4bebd81d44464036ec5396451
"}]
commit_message:
Link to os-security-groups in server-create response

The Nova API always adds the 'default' security group to a server POST
response even if the Neutron network that the instance is using has port
security disabled. This is misleading. A better approach is to provide a
link to the os-security-groups API in the server POST response so the user
can get the security groups for the server after it's created.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint server-create-secgroups-response-link

Change-Id: Ie321d1d8bbc81fb4bebd81d44464036ec5396451

commit_message:
Virt image properties boot time override via flavor

This utilizes the Nova flavor extra-specs so that it is possible to
override any image metadata properties at instance creation time.
This avoids the need to upload the same image to glance multiple
times in order to set slightly different properties for some use cases.

Blueprint: virt-image-props-boot-override-via-flavor
Change-Id: I37b22e9235fbda55957a7a2eda7980bc7996c71f

subject: Add new filter based on thresholds of metrics
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 7664, 'name': 'Joe Cropper', 'email': 'jwcroppe@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jwcroppe'}, {'_account_id': 14927, 'name': 'Balaji Narayanan', 'email': 'lists@balajin.net', 'username': 'balajijegan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-02 22:44:26.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/metrics_threshold_filter.rst'], 'message': 'Add new filter based on thresholds of metrics

Operators want to avoid scheduling more VMs on a host(HV), when the CPU
usage on the HV is hot. A combination of metric weight and metrics-based
filter, gives a nice way to order the HVs, while scheduling. But, it
does not give a choice to exclude a HV, based on the usage. So, at
present, operators resort to disable a host from scheduling to avoid
further degradation of performance on the HV. At the same time, when the
usage cools down, operators enable those HVs back manually. It will be
useful to have a filter for the HVs based on thresholds defined for the
metrics - thus automating the manual work in a programmatic way.

Change-Id: Ie3c7ee1584e7ebcb238d19f7462ca4b6ba605b54
'}]
commit_message:
Add new filter based on thresholds of metrics

Operators want to avoid scheduling more VMs on a host(HV), when the CPU
usage on the HV is hot. A combination of metric weight and metrics-based
filter, gives a nice way to order the HVs, while scheduling. But, it
does not give a choice to exclude a HV, based on the usage. So, at
present, operators resort to disable a host from scheduling to avoid
further degradation of performance on the HV. At the same time, when the
usage cools down, operators enable those HVs back manually. It will be
useful to have a filter for the HVs based on thresholds defined for the
metrics - thus automating the manual work in a programmatic way.

Change-Id: Ie3c7ee1584e7ebcb238d19f7462ca4b6ba605b54

subject: Baremetal migration
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-02-02 04:26:48.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/baremetal-migration.rst'], 'message': 'Baremetal migration

When a baremetal node is broken, it should be migrated into other

And this spec will implement the integration of Ironic and nova about
this feature. i.e. it will meet the step-1 of blueprint
baremetal-migration-evacuation.

Change-Id: I2f6a4e66a7a62b41d66e13f6b9a953d5dd31c76e
Depends-on: I3776dd497e6b1d8cf4f7e59f8663d9d787c8d1f1
Implements: blueprint baremetal-migration-evacuation
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <chen.tang@easystack.cn>

commit_message:
Baremetal migration

When a baremetal node is broken, it should be migrated into other
redundant node. This feature should also depend on the improvement
in Ironic story which will be implemented by the following Ironic BP.
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/bare-metal-node-n+1-redundancy

And this spec will implement the integration of Ironic and nova about
this feature. i.e. it will meet the step-1 of blueprint
baremetal-migration-evacuation.

Change-Id: I2f6a4e66a7a62b41d66e13f6b9a953d5dd31c76e
Depends-on: I3776dd497e6b1d8cf4f7e59f8663d9d787c8d1f1
Implements: blueprint baremetal-migration-evacuation
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <chen.tang@easystack.cn>

commit_message:
Add compute node on the go

While working on multi-node network, when we need more
computation power, it is difficult to add compute node.
So we wish to provide a way to automatically add compute
node on the go.

Change-Id: I08c4a77831a47c41851f62126d53e2a76823e138
Implements: blueprint Add compute node on the go

own deleted instances.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1063, 'name': 'Ed Leafe', 'email': 'ed@leafe.com', 'username': 'ed-leafe'}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 8688, 'name': 'Alexis Lee', 'email': 'openstack@lxsli.co.uk', 'username': 'lxsli'}, {'_account_id': 8768, 'name': 'Chris Friesen', 'email': 'chris.friesen@windriver.com', 'username': 'cbf123'}, {'_account_id': 12175, 'name': 'Eli Qiao', 'email': 'qiaoliyong@gmail.com', 'username': 'Eli'}, {'_account_id': 13248, 'name': 'Wenzhi Yu', 'email': 'wenzhi_yu@163.com', 'username': 'yuywz'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-17 05:50:58.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/move-disk-available-least-calculation-to-rt.rst'], 'message': "Move calculation of 'disk_available_least' to ResourceTracker

Currently in libvirt[1] and xenapi[2] driver, method
'get_available_resource()' will report 'disk_available_least' in its
return value.

However, libvirt and xenapi driver only take the instances known by
hypervisor into account but ignore the instances being migrate to/from
the host.

To solve this problem, We need to move the calculation of
'ComputeNode.disk_vailable_least' to resource tracker, because only
the resource tracker holding the global resource lock knows the current
usage of resources since it can take both existing instances and
ongoing migrations into account.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0b3/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L5416
[2]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0b3/nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py#L458

Related-Bug: #1517442
Blueprint move-disk-available-least-calculation-to-rt

Change-Id: Ib99006c78cf8f0db1608a78fbec60d5b568a1480
"}]
commit_message:
Move calculation of 'disk_available_least' to ResourceTracker

Currently in libvirt[1] and xenapi[2] driver, method
'get_available_resource()' will report 'disk_available_least' in its
return value.

However, libvirt and xenapi driver only take the instances known by
hypervisor into account but ignore the instances being migrate to/from
the host.

To solve this problem, We need to move the calculation of
'ComputeNode.disk_vailable_least' to resource tracker, because only
the resource tracker holding the global resource lock knows the current
usage of resources since it can take both existing instances and
ongoing migrations into account.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0b3/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L5416
[2]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0b3/nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py#L458

Related-Bug: #1517442
Blueprint move-disk-available-least-calculation-to-rt

Change-Id: Ib99006c78cf8f0db1608a78fbec60d5b568a1480

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-05-27 13:29:55.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/ordered-filter-scheduler.rst'], 'message': 'Add newton spec for ordered filter scheduler

The current filter scheduler is hard to configure once you get past a
very small number of filters and weights. Also the difference between
filters and weights causes friction when wanting to tweak the scheduler
configuration.

This spec proposes a method of using purely filter functions to order
the lists of hosts, in a way that seems easier to understand for
deployers. To ease the transition, the weight based system is kept to
break a tie in any of the preferences.

This renames scheduler_default_filters to scheduler_filters_requirements
and adds the new config option scheduler_filters_preferences

Change-Id: Ica0c7c0c57f230b2358ba5db23bc14eba8f1d291
'}]
commit_message:
Add newton spec for ordered filter scheduler

The current filter scheduler is hard to configure once you get past a
very small number of filters and weights. Also the difference between
filters and weights causes friction when wanting to tweak the scheduler
configuration.

This spec proposes a method of using purely filter functions to order
the lists of hosts, in a way that seems easier to understand for
deployers. To ease the transition, the weight based system is kept to
break a tie in any of the preferences.

This renames scheduler_default_filters to scheduler_filters_requirements
and adds the new config option scheduler_filters_preferences

Change-Id: Ica0c7c0c57f230b2358ba5db23bc14eba8f1d291

commit_message:
Device tag - pci address mapping in image metadata.

This feature will allow users to express device role tag - pci address mappings
in image metadata. During creation of a instance devices referenced by device
tags will be configured to have pci address specified in the mapping.

Change-Id: Ia883bd3e4c2e2657fa365aa64ddebc62353436a2
Blueprint: image-prop-pci-mappings

commit_message:
Adds post-copy live migration support to Nova

At present, only pre-copy live migration is supported at OpenStack.
This spec proposes adding support for post-copy live migration at
OpenStack, including the possibility of lively switch from pre-copy
to post-copy for ongoing live migrations.

Change-Id: I75add03c331204fcd9b48d37c52427829eb17339
Signed-off-by: Luis Tomas <luis5tb@gmail.com>

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-05 20:24:55.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/nova-create-notification-scheduler-hints.rst'], 'message': "instance.create notifications should emit with scheduler hints

One use case would be Heat's stack_scheduler_hints. Currently, when the
Heat configuration stack_scheduler_hints is set to True, Heat's
scheduler hints are sent to Nova. However, Nova notifications don't have
this information available.

An enhancement for Nova Notifications would be to include in the
notification scheduler hint information that is passed into Nova. This
could be done by adding 'scheduler_hints' to the create notifications'
payload.

Change-Id: I2088e9a14bc73b7d3deeb2e35e474830cc9063ee
"}]
commit_message:
instance.create notifications should emit with scheduler hints

One use case would be Heat's stack_scheduler_hints. Currently, when the
Heat configuration stack_scheduler_hints is set to True, Heat's
scheduler hints are sent to Nova. However, Nova notifications don't have
this information available.

An enhancement for Nova Notifications would be to include in the
notification scheduler hint information that is passed into Nova. This
could be done by adding 'scheduler_hints' to the create notifications'
payload.

Change-Id: I2088e9a14bc73b7d3deeb2e35e474830cc9063ee

Hide Exclusive Availability zones

The blueprint propose some modification to the availability list API to hide
exclusive availability zones, if filter AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation
is enabled.

Blueprint: hide-exclusive-availability-zone

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-05-18 17:03:05.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/direct-download-for-rbd.rst'], 'message': 'Add direct download feature for rbd glance backend

This blueprint aims to support for the direct download feature
for "rbd glance image backend" when nova boot.
Supporting for direct downloads of glance locations is
already added by plug-in modules.
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/37817)
And this feature only can support file not rbd images.

Added new rbd download scheme for Nova.
With that change Nova can download RBD images directly from
Ceph using 'rbd export' command not involving rather
slow download by HTTP from Glance server.

Instead of copying through glance node, nova-compute service
can directly download image from ceph to
compute node using rbd direct url.

the workflow is simple as follows:

    1. Create an image with ceph glance backend.
    2. nova boot with the image created above.

Configuration options for nova.conf should be added as below.
 : allowed_direct_url_schemes = [file,rbd]

Change-Id: I88ac1c772a56abb284d77319e07c8bf6c294b4da
Implements: blueprint direct-download-for-rbd
'}]
commit_message:
Add direct download feature for rbd glance backend

This blueprint aims to support for the direct download feature
for "rbd glance image backend" when nova boot.
Supporting for direct downloads of glance locations is
already added by plug-in modules.
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/37817)
And this feature only can support file not rbd images.

Added new rbd download scheme for Nova.
With that change Nova can download RBD images directly from
Ceph using 'rbd export' command not involving rather
slow download by HTTP from Glance server.

Instead of copying through glance node, nova-compute service
can directly download image from ceph to
compute node using rbd direct url.

the workflow is simple as follows:

    1. Create an image with ceph glance backend.
    2. nova boot with the image created above.

Configuration options for nova.conf should be added as below.
 : allowed_direct_url_schemes = [file,rbd]

Change-Id: I88ac1c772a56abb284d77319e07c8bf6c294b4da
Implements: blueprint direct-download-for-rbd

commit_message:
Standardize capabilities using Enums

We propose to standardize the representation of capabilities (system,
host, hypervisor, device, etc) into a set of
nova.objects.fields.Enum-based classes that codify various currently
free-form strings into a structured set of standardized capability
descriptors.

Change-Id: Icb1daaedb9d576594e4bb455dda3443fedd9004e
blueprint: standardize-capabilities

commit_message:
Add tooz service group driver

This specification proposes adding a new service group driver based that
makes use of tooz (a new oslo library).
It also talks about deprecating the existing Zookeeper and Memcache
service group drivers, and a migration strategy to the new tooz driver.

Co-Authored-By: Joshua Harlow <harlowja@yahoo-inc.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john.garbutt@rackspace.com>

Previously-approved: liberty
Implements: blueprint tooz-for-service-groups
Depends On: I3cae9495373c4334fedb18b64d907f3a6ac5ab92

Change-Id: Ibf70c2dbe308fc8e4dd277d8c75c4445b3dfce90

subject: Modify Nova API to reject invalid operations on physical servers
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-17 02:13:59.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/reject-invalid-operation-on-physical-server.rst'], 'message': 'Modify Nova API to reject invalid operations on physical servers

Physical servers provisioned by Ironic do not support certain variety of
operations that virtual servers provisioned by Nova do. But Nova still
allows to perform actions(pause, resize...) on physical servers that
can only be applied to virtual servers. We need to modify Nova API to
reject invalid operations on physical servers.

APIImpact

Related-Bug: #1483639
Blueprint reject-invalid-operation-on-physical-server

Change-Id: Ibfc7165c5f223cee944ec40390846d56b8657f66
'}]
commit_message:
Modify Nova API to reject invalid operations on physical servers

Physical servers provisioned by Ironic do not support certain variety of
operations that virtual servers provisioned by Nova do. But Nova still
allows to perform actions(pause, resize...) on physical servers that
can only be applied to virtual servers. We need to modify Nova API to
reject invalid operations on physical servers.

APIImpact

Related-Bug: #1483639
Blueprint reject-invalid-operation-on-physical-server

Change-Id: Ibfc7165c5f223cee944ec40390846d56b8657f66

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-24 10:49:02.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/add-network-monitor.rst'], 'message': "Add network monitor for compute node

Nova blueprint 'utilization-aware-scheduling'[1] gave nova scheduler
the ability to schedule VMs based upon transient resource usage like
CPU utilization.

This blueprint proposes to add network monitor to collect network
related metrics on compute node. Resource tracker can get the metrics
from network monitor[2], then nova scheduler can schedule VMs based
upon the network utilization on compute node.

There was effort[3] trying to do this but it was obsoleted, this bp
will continue the work based on it.

[1]https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/utilization-aware-scheduling
[2]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0rc1/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L464
[3]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/44007/

Blueprint add-network-monitor

Change-Id: Ib2149f2b86e2133c8e7c17f4b8ad40d01b06d436
"}]
commit_message:
Add network monitor for compute node

Nova blueprint 'utilization-aware-scheduling'[1] gave nova scheduler
the ability to schedule VMs based upon transient resource usage like
CPU utilization.

This blueprint proposes to add network monitor to collect network
related metrics on compute node. Resource tracker can get the metrics
from network monitor[2], then nova scheduler can schedule VMs based
upon the network utilization on compute node.

There was effort[3] trying to do this but it was obsoleted, this bp
will continue the work based on it.

[1]https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/utilization-aware-scheduling
[2]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0rc1/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L464
[3]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/44007/

Blueprint add-network-monitor

Change-Id: Ib2149f2b86e2133c8e7c17f4b8ad40d01b06d436

commit_message:
Report Host Memory and Disk Info

This proposal is to report host memory and disk total/used information to
Ceilometer by notifications.

Implements: blueprint report-host-memory-disk-info

Change-Id: I51bbf355e48d8797814ae6d0f3a1a1d7016509a2

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-26 07:44:21.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example).
To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Ieb68867726f8959ac5dc0f48fa923281cd2134fa

subject: Fix unit tests for oslo.config 3.18.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 20:25:03.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/unit/test_agent/test_backends/test_msdns.py', 'designate/tests/test_agent/test_backends/test_djbdns.py', 'designate/tests/unit/test_agent/test_backends/test_djbdns.py'], 'message': 'Fix unit tests for oslo.config 3.18.0

The unit tests were improperly overriding the server list with a tuple
rather than a list. In newer versions of oslo.config they are no longer
converting the values which leads to unit test failures. This change
updates the unit tests to use a list for the server override.

Change-Id: I429417e26eb535560821cc8e31dbecc9f1d26e6d
Closes-Bug: #1635717
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unit tests for oslo.config 3.18.0

The unit tests were improperly overriding the server list with a tuple
rather than a list. In newer versions of oslo.config they are no longer
converting the values which leads to unit test failures. This change
updates the unit tests to use a list for the server override.

Change-Id: I429417e26eb535560821cc8e31dbecc9f1d26e6d
Closes-Bug: #1635717

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 06:16:52.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/common/models.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I1777e08e723ec6efc8f10fa86b01220aaa108c41
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I1777e08e723ec6efc8f10fa86b01220aaa108c41

revisions:

commit_message:
Default ethertype to IPv4 if Neutron's enable_ipv6 is false

* When OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK's enable_ipv6 is set to False set
* ethertype to IPv4 and also assign IP version of CIDR to IPv4.

Change-Id: I37eeccc46fc54e9790634a70e0148bda2f537c7d
Closes-bug: #1631551

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-07-29 20:13:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/vmware/test_vmware_vmdk.py', 'requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/vmdk.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Mark oslo.vmware as optional dependency

A driver specific requirement module should not be a hard requirement,
since the choice of drivers is based on operator. oslo.vmware module
is to be moved out of the requirements.txt and instead listed as
optional dependency using extras functionality in setup.cfg.

A check is added to the vmdk driver to gracefully handle import errors
if the vmdk driver is used and oslo.vmware is not found. Unit test
is added to verify check on vmdk driver.

Change-Id: I358a717533469559d96381a420fe7faf7918649d
Closes-Bug: #1513212
'}]
commit_message:
Mark oslo.vmware as optional dependency

A driver specific requirement module should not be a hard requirement,
since the choice of drivers is based on operator. oslo.vmware module
is to be moved out of the requirements.txt and instead listed as
optional dependency using extras functionality in setup.cfg.

A check is added to the vmdk driver to gracefully handle import errors
if the vmdk driver is used and oslo.vmware is not found. Unit test
is added to verify check on vmdk driver.

Change-Id: I358a717533469559d96381a420fe7faf7918649d
Closes-Bug: #1513212

commit_message:
zone_name is null in zone trasfer request response

The response to API call has zone_id set with
zone id but zone name is set to 'null'.

Change-Id: Id2d093891953efcbb125560ea1113b8a9e613a9c

commit_message:
Add --get <key> option to `swift capabilities` / `swift info`

This allows us to do things like:

    $ swift info --get swift.version
    2.5.1.dev274

    $ MAX_SIZE=`swift info --get swift.max_file_size`
    $ SEG_SIZE=`bc <<< "$MAX_SIZE / 20"`
    $ swift upload -S $SEG_SIZE ...

    $ swift info --get slo > /dev/null 2> /dev/null
    $ if [ $? -eq 2 ]; then SWIFT_ARGS="$SWIFT_ARGS --use-slo"; fi

Change-Id: Ide98b862c3b511ba169ff45067e3910c6e1ab953
