revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-27 19:09:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_quotas.py'], 'message': 'Fix database poison warnings, part 22

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings from:

    nova.tests.unit.api.openstack.compute.test_quotas.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I1f6d5e161abea3a66fe09159b84e100c123561bd
Related-Bug: #1568414
'}]
commit_message:
Fix database poison warnings, part 22

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings from:

    nova.tests.unit.api.openstack.compute.test_quotas.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I1f6d5e161abea3a66fe09159b84e100c123561bd
Related-Bug: #1568414

commit_message:
microversion selector - dropdown

This does a few things:

* Change from button list to a select combo box.
** This allows users to type the number they want
* Add the ablity to tag versions to releases
** E.G. Say mitaka was released with 2.27, it will
   show in the list as "2.27 - Mitaka".
** This currently set as a config option in
   conf.py as a dict like:

  os_api_ref_release_microversions = {
      '2.27' : 'mitaka',
      '2.10': 'liberty'
  }

* Uses https://github.com/danielfarrell/bootstrap-combobox
** Apache Licenced

Change-Id: Ica7dd55cdbf413f03ea635aefb627a705132a73e

subject: Add possibility to reserve IP address for specific nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-26 17:14:00.000000000', 'files': ['devops/tests/test_manager.py', 'devops/models/network.py', 'devops/models/environment.py'], 'message': "Add possibility to reserve IP address for specific nodes

- In the YAML template section 'address_pools', IP address for
  a specific node can be specified in the 'ip_reserved' field:
  <group_name>_<node_name>: <ip_address>

  For example:

    address_pools:
      public-pool01:
        net: 172.16.10.0/24:24
        params:
          ip_reserved:
            gateway: +1
            l2_network_device: +1
            default_cfg01.mk22-lab-advanced.local: 172.16.10.100
            default_ctl01.mk22-lab-advanced.local: +101
            default_ctl02.mk22-lab-advanced.local: +102
            default_ctl03.mk22-lab-advanced.local: +103
          ip_ranges:
            dhcp: [+100, -2]

- Erase the failed environment in case of creation failure, to not
  leave inconsistent objects on host and in database.

Change-Id: Ic53f1f69d718998448b6f26fe46b4e8130addbb1
"}]
commit_message:
Add possibility to reserve IP address for specific nodes

- In the YAML template section 'address_pools', IP address for
  a specific node can be specified in the 'ip_reserved' field:
  <group_name>_<node_name>: <ip_address>

  For example:

    address_pools:
      public-pool01:
        net: 172.16.10.0/24:24
        params:
          ip_reserved:
            gateway: +1
            l2_network_device: +1
            default_cfg01.mk22-lab-advanced.local: 172.16.10.100
            default_ctl01.mk22-lab-advanced.local: +101
            default_ctl02.mk22-lab-advanced.local: +102
            default_ctl03.mk22-lab-advanced.local: +103
          ip_ranges:
            dhcp: [+100, -2]

- Erase the failed environment in case of creation failure, to not
  leave inconsistent objects on host and in database.

Change-Id: Ic53f1f69d718998448b6f26fe46b4e8130addbb1

commit_message:
Fix policy file used for testing

The policy file is hard coded to the fake one which is used for
unit tests. This patch fixes it by providing the possibility to
overwrite the default value and use the real policy files for the
in-tree functional tests.

Closes-Bug: #1606715
Change-Id: I6f9b856c13ee1264de892aabe7fdb824db8f2cf1

commit_message:
Removing token revoke / delete calls

Keysonte is changing the nature of tokens, timeouts, and long
running tasks.  In addition, horizon can also cause issues where
a user starts a long running tasks, logs out, and then the token
fails authenticaion.   Just removing this problematic logic.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/session-extendable-tokens

Closes-Bug: #1637460
Change-Id: I5eda08e95d8df72ba601181f02a72de37c5393fd

subject: Fix same-host offline install race
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 16:21:59.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install_offline.yml', 'tasks/install_source.yml', 'handlers/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fix same-host offline install race

When pip_offline_install is used on a deployment such as an AIO where
the host being installed to ie. "aio1" is also the deployment host,
a race condition existed where the pip wheels would be downloaded,
uploaded to the same path on the target host, and then cleaned up
from the deployment host before the installation was continued.

The result is a race condition where the wheels are removed from
the target prior to installation due to the target being local.

This changes the pip offline install cleanup to run as a handler
so the cleanup can take place after the role has completed its work
with the cached wheels.

Change-Id: Ibf36118d42950f0f64f83b6ffc3601c9a241289d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix same-host offline install race

When pip_offline_install is used on a deployment such as an AIO where
the host being installed to ie. "aio1" is also the deployment host,
a race condition existed where the pip wheels would be downloaded,
uploaded to the same path on the target host, and then cleaned up
from the deployment host before the installation was continued.

The result is a race condition where the wheels are removed from
the target prior to installation due to the target being local.

This changes the pip offline install cleanup to run as a handler
so the cleanup can take place after the role has completed its work
with the cached wheels.

Change-Id: Ibf36118d42950f0f64f83b6ffc3601c9a241289d

commit_message:
Add nova.ListAndSearchHypervisors scenario

List all servers belonging to specific hypervisor.

The scenario first list all hypervisors,then find its hostname,
then list all servers belonging to the hypervisor
Measure the "nova hypervisor-servers <hostname>" command performance.

Change-Id: I8511a9790037ee5f3bab003309f2debe31b00590

commit_message:
Transform instance.resume notifications

The instance.resume.start and instance.resume.end notifications
are transformed to the versioned framework using the generic
InstanceActionNotification and InstanceActionPayload class.

Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-ocata

Change-Id: I923971ea2f6c1f450ace27b246aa6f372a72bb30

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 0.11.0 in test-requirements

Hacking's latest release is 0.11.0. Most other ironic projects are using
this release.

These updates are done project-by-project to avoid introducing
unexpected new hacking rules to projects. This version bump already
applies cleanly to ironic-lib with no code style changes.

Change-Id: I6e47390299bf8f073b8c8413f0cd4e1365f938bb

subject: Added policy checks for Project>Volumes Panel
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-09 15:01:20.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/panel.py'], 'message': 'Added policy checks for Project>Volumes Panel

Before if a user/operator wanted to restrict access to the Volumes
Panel via the policy.json file by setting these values to:
"volume:get_all": "rule:context_is_admin"
nothing happened after restarting horizon.
This patch adds the policy checks so the access to the Volumes panel
be restricted by changing the cinder_policy.json file

Change-Id: Ibc53be505a053353062c03ea5d31e9fd800a5dcb
Closes-Bug: #1579111
'}]
commit_message:
Added policy checks for Project>Volumes Panel

Before if a user/operator wanted to restrict access to the Volumes
Panel via the policy.json file by setting these values to:
"volume:get_all": "rule:context_is_admin"
nothing happened after restarting horizon.
This patch adds the policy checks so the access to the Volumes panel
be restricted by changing the cinder_policy.json file

Change-Id: Ibc53be505a053353062c03ea5d31e9fd800a5dcb
Closes-Bug: #1579111

commit_message:
Add support for db_max_retries param

The db_max_retries parameter regulates the number of reconnection
attempts performed after an error raised rather than at startup.

Closes-Bug: 1579718

plan API datamodule. User can save the extra_info of resourece
instances to this table.

blueprint instances-extra-info

This code (or a version of it) is being shared by at least nova
and keystonemiddleware and it seems like a good idea to move it
to being common shared code (especially due to the importance

commit_message:
Create secretutils and include 'constant_time_compare' function

This code (or a version of it) is being shared by at least nova
and keystonemiddleware and it seems like a good idea to move it
to being common shared code (especially due to the importance
of getting this code correct).

This adds an initial secretutils and adds tests for it.

Change-Id: Ia603202a065d5b345608e712f63f7af21fd74dea

subject: Use assertGreater(Equal) over assertTrue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 09:39:04.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_attach_interfaces.py', 'tempest/api/compute/admin/test_hosts.py', 'tempest/api/compute/admin/test_availability_zone.py', 'tempest/api/compute/admin/test_hypervisor_negative.py', 'tempest/api/image/v1/test_images.py', 'tempest/api/compute/admin/test_hypervisor.py', 'tempest/api/compute/admin/test_hosts_negative.py', 'tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_addresses.py', 'tempest/api/volume/test_availability_zone.py'], 'message': 'Use assertGreater(Equal) over assertTrue

As in I2c13d28c54ae3a9ff562448e7a16ab54d71b29b5, assertGreater/
assertGreaterEqual provides a nicer error message when failing if
no additional error message is specified.
This is to fix other occurrences of this kind.

Change-Id: I17a55f37026e26355a214541776975ad2efe70b2
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertGreater(Equal) over assertTrue

As in I2c13d28c54ae3a9ff562448e7a16ab54d71b29b5, assertGreater/
assertGreaterEqual provides a nicer error message when failing if
no additional error message is specified.
This is to fix other occurrences of this kind.

Change-Id: I17a55f37026e26355a214541776975ad2efe70b2

commit_message:
Fix bug in "nova/tests/unit/virt/test_virt_drivers.py" for os-vif

Commit 735f710 moved the os_vif.initialize() code. This lead to an
error in "test_virt_drivers.LibvirtConnTestCase.test_set_admin_password":

  AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'vif

This change initializes os_vif in "test_virt_driver" as it was done
for "libvirt.test_driver" in commit 735f710.

Change-Id: Idf2fcb1df92dd4aa1761d955ea149090263d42d8
Closes-Bug: #1632987

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-18 12:47:56.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/support-matrix.ini', 'nova/conf/serial_console.py'], 'message': "Update docs for serial console support

There are two changes here:

1. The serial_console config option group help text is
   updated to point out that hyper-v also supports serial
   console access. This is based on virt drivers that
   implement the 'get_serial_console' method.

2. The hypervisor feature matrix is updated to point out
   that the vmware driver does not support getting serial
   console output. This is based on virt drivers that
   implement the 'get_console_output' method.

Closes-Bug: #1632135

Change-Id: Ibf7f865e2b768e5ea3d7a7ec7cbf77bd8997c50f
"}]
commit_message:
Update docs for serial console support

There are two changes here:

1. The serial_console config option group help text is
   updated to point out that hyper-v also supports serial
   console access. This is based on virt drivers that
   implement the 'get_serial_console' method.

2. The hypervisor feature matrix is updated to point out
   that the vmware driver does not support getting serial
   console output. This is based on virt drivers that
   implement the 'get_console_output' method.

Closes-Bug: #1632135

Change-Id: Ibf7f865e2b768e5ea3d7a7ec7cbf77bd8997c50f

commit_message:
Prefill Sensu client custom config

- Custom config has to contain OpenStack auth information,
  so it has to be generated for user during deployment.
  This patch maintains the ability to provide a custom
  configuration for the Sensu client.

Change-Id: If449642c4bbad683421e1f461b8721e655db0c45
(cherry picked from commit 9d9eecea56b15f6f96f9d33def8045afb6527051)

commit_message:
Add py_req_cleanup macro to all Python spec templates

Fedora specs use to remove requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt
during %prep, to prevent any attempt to download from PyPi while building.

We now have a py_req_cleanup macro in openstack-macros, so let's use it.
This will only change the outcome in packages using centos.

Change-Id: I7d7a27d4909990a9d26433cd65e799cae3af7904

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-10-11 12:31:02.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/websocket-proxy-to-host-security.rst'], 'message': 'Websockify security proxy framework

This proposes a generic framework for supporting TLS
encryption between the console proxy servers and the
compute nodes for SPICE, VNC and serial ports.

NB, the spec content is largely rewritten to better
reflect what was actually implemented. The key change
to previous cycles is the removal of the config
parameter that let you set the classname for the
security proxy, thus indirectly enabling tls. Instead
you the config explicitly says whether you want tls or
not and nova chooses the impl to match.

Previously approved: Juno, Kilo, Mitaka, Newton
Blueprint websocket-proxy-to-host-security
Change-Id: I44b472d0907606885ff75ffce27dc3f46f6565f4
'}]
commit_message:
Websockify security proxy framework

This proposes a generic framework for supporting TLS
encryption between the console proxy servers and the
compute nodes for SPICE, VNC and serial ports.

NB, the spec content is largely rewritten to better
reflect what was actually implemented. The key change
to previous cycles is the removal of the config
parameter that let you set the classname for the
security proxy, thus indirectly enabling tls. Instead
you the config explicitly says whether you want tls or
not and nova chooses the impl to match.

Previously approved: Juno, Kilo, Mitaka, Newton
Blueprint websocket-proxy-to-host-security
Change-Id: I44b472d0907606885ff75ffce27dc3f46f6565f4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-26 18:18:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Fix database poison warnings, part 20

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings from:

    nova.tests.unit.compute.test_compute.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I4f3679bf97ec0240ede5beaf202ee3c60c230a8a
Related-Bug: #1568414
'}]
commit_message:
Fix database poison warnings, part 20

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings from:

    nova.tests.unit.compute.test_compute.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I4f3679bf97ec0240ede5beaf202ee3c60c230a8a

commit_message:
Fix database poison warnings, part 21

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings from:

    nova.tests.unit.compute.test_compute_api.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

commit_message:
Fix database poison warnings, part 19

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings from:

    nova.tests.unit.virt.ironic.test_driver.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: I4181775eb0e89e8a21e6af8dddb3c9ffd09a6b83
Related-Bug: #1568414

This patch modifies the fields.ResourceClass field type from an
EnumField to a StringField. This keeps the over-the-wire format of the
field backwards-compatible while allowing us to add non-standardized,
custom resource classes to the new resource_classes database table.

We change all locations of fields.ResourceClass.index() and
fields.ResourceClass.from_index() to use the ResourceClassCache object
added in the previous patch in this series and add some check logic in
Inventory and Allocation object's obj_make_compatible() methods to
ensure backversioned objects requesting or sending with a resource class
string different than the set of strings in the ResourceClass field at
the time of this patch raises a ValueError.

Change-Id: I2c1d4ae277ba25791c426e1c638dca1b1cb207a4
blueprint: custom-resource-classes
"}]
commit_message:
placement: change resource class to a StringField

This patch modifies the fields.ResourceClass field type from an
EnumField to a StringField. This keeps the over-the-wire format of the
field backwards-compatible while allowing us to add non-standardized,
custom resource classes to the new resource_classes database table.

We change all locations of fields.ResourceClass.index() and
fields.ResourceClass.from_index() to use the ResourceClassCache object
added in the previous patch in this series and add some check logic in
Inventory and Allocation object's obj_make_compatible() methods to
ensure backversioned objects requesting or sending with a resource class
string different than the set of strings in the ResourceClass field at
the time of this patch raises a ValueError.

Change-Id: I2c1d4ae277ba25791c426e1c638dca1b1cb207a4
blueprint: custom-resource-classes

subject: Fix permissions for the Nova lock directory in systemd
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-27 19:41:53.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_pre_install.yml', 'templates/nova-systemd-tempfiles.j2', 'templates/nova.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fix permissions for the Nova lock directory in systemd

The directory set as `lock_path` in `nova.conf` must be created with
the nova system user as its owner, otherwise the VIF plugin would fail
to acquire a lock when launching an instance.

Here we set up systemd to create this directory with correct owner and
permissions, besides moving its path to a `nova_lock_path` variable.

Apparently, the `/var/lock/{{ item.value.service_name }}` directory,
which is also created by `nova-systemd-tempfiles.j2`, is not needed at
all. But as this patch is intended to be backported to a stable release,
we keep it by now to avoid any unforeseen issues.

Change-Id: I9886778eddc23f0f71dfdfc87f4f715054946b3d
Closes-Bug: #1636604
'}]
commit_message:
Fix permissions for the Nova lock directory in systemd

The directory set as `lock_path` in `nova.conf` must be created with
the nova system user as its owner, otherwise the VIF plugin would fail
to acquire a lock when launching an instance.

Here we set up systemd to create this directory with correct owner and
permissions, besides moving its path to a `nova_lock_path` variable.

Apparently, the `/var/lock/{{ item.value.service_name }}` directory,
which is also created by `nova-systemd-tempfiles.j2`, is not needed at
all. But as this patch is intended to be backported to a stable release,
we keep it by now to avoid any unforeseen issues.

Change-Id: I9886778eddc23f0f71dfdfc87f4f715054946b3d
Closes-Bug: #1636604

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Replace "SLO" tag with "ServiceLevel" tag

The VMAX3 XML file has a tag currently named "SLO"
which we will replace with "ServiceLevel", to be
consistent with terminology used by VMAX3 community,
as well as the CamelCase naming convention. This patch
modifies the code to reflect the recommended change in
the XML file.

Change-Id: I658fc1c618607995d724d3df89f2055da767670e
Closes-Bug: #1618908

subject: Remove ansible_ssh_host variable from inventory
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-27 16:51:22.000000000', 'files': ['lib/generate.py', 'releasenotes/notes/ansible_ssh_host_var_removed-984abb4bbeb17366.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove ansible_ssh_host variable from inventory

Due to upstream Ansible deprecating the `ansible_ssh_host` variable,
this key is removed from the generated inventory in order to avoid
confusion. While Newton also supports Ansible 2.x, this change is
intended to only be in effect from Ocata forward.

From
http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/intro_inventory.html#hosts-and-groups:

"Ansible 2.0 has deprecated the “ssh” from ansible_ssh_user,
ansible_ssh_host, and ansible_ssh_port to become ansible_user,
ansible_host, and ansible_port. If you are using a version of Ansible
prior to 2.0, you should continue using the older style variables
(ansible_ssh_*). These shorter variables are ignored, without warning,
in older versions of Ansible."

Fixes-Bug: #1636606

Change-Id: If43b28247a9df3db76217b1147fab785f1235532
'}]
commit_message:
Remove ansible_ssh_host variable from inventory

Due to upstream Ansible deprecating the `ansible_ssh_host` variable,
this key is removed from the generated inventory in order to avoid
confusion. While Newton also supports Ansible 2.x, this change is
intended to only be in effect from Ocata forward.

From
http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/intro_inventory.html#hosts-and-groups:

"Ansible 2.0 has deprecated the “ssh” from ansible_ssh_user,
ansible_ssh_host, and ansible_ssh_port to become ansible_user,
ansible_host, and ansible_port. If you are using a version of Ansible
prior to 2.0, you should continue using the older style variables
(ansible_ssh_*). These shorter variables are ignored, without warning,
in older versions of Ansible."

Fixes-Bug: #1636606

Change-Id: If43b28247a9df3db76217b1147fab785f1235532

subject: Fix broken rabbitmqctl commands when using ipv6
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 09:12:19.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': 'Fix broken rabbitmqctl commands when using ipv6

When deploying via ipv6, rabbitmq-ctl commands have the following
issues:

- `rabbitmq cluster_status` shows nodedown alerts
- list_queues / list_connections hang
- `rabbitmqctl node_health_check` fails with an error.

* There is no any issue while performing activity on RHOS setup(From
* horizon/cli). i.e. RHOS environment is functioning as expected.

For example:
sudo rabbitmqctl node_health_check -n rabbit@node1
Checking health of node 'rabbit@node1' ...
Heath check failed:
health check of node 'rabbit@node1' fails: nodedown

The problem is that we are missing the following in
/etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-env.conf:
RABBITMQ_CTL_ERL_ARGS="-proto_dist inet6_tcp"

Fix these by setting the appropriate RABBITMQ_CTL_ERL_ARGS when
deploying ipv6.

Note: The mitaka fix cannot be cherry-picked because it has to
happen in tripleo-heat-templates as opposed to puppet-tripleo
(newton/master).

Closes-Bug: #1633693

Change-Id: I13d4f104c87d1693322876458b6b07b103f3d2d0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken rabbitmqctl commands when using ipv6

When deploying via ipv6, rabbitmq-ctl commands have the following
issues:

- `rabbitmq cluster_status` shows nodedown alerts
- list_queues / list_connections hang
- `rabbitmqctl node_health_check` fails with an error.

* There is no any issue while performing activity on RHOS setup(From
* horizon/cli). i.e. RHOS environment is functioning as expected.

For example:
sudo rabbitmqctl node_health_check -n rabbit@node1
Checking health of node 'rabbit@node1' ...
Heath check failed:
health check of node 'rabbit@node1' fails: nodedown

The problem is that we are missing the following in
/etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-env.conf:
RABBITMQ_CTL_ERL_ARGS="-proto_dist inet6_tcp"

Fix these by setting the appropriate RABBITMQ_CTL_ERL_ARGS when
deploying ipv6.

Note: The mitaka fix cannot be cherry-picked because it has to
happen in tripleo-heat-templates as opposed to puppet-tripleo
(newton/master).

Closes-Bug: #1633693

Change-Id: I13d4f104c87d1693322876458b6b07b103f3d2d0

subject: Fix the stonith property during upgrades
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-27 08:34:07.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_1.sh'], 'message': "Fix the stonith property during upgrades

We currently set the stonith property from all controller nodes during
upgrade. This is racy and can actually end up disabling stonith after
the upgrade even if when it was enabled.

Let's set the property only from the bootstrap node.

Change-Id: Id4afb867b485ac853be874a0179a7ed7cc914068
Closes-Bug: #1635294
(cherry picked from commit 7ce217909ab0ef1492e20cfc44470aeeaec3a791)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the stonith property during upgrades

We currently set the stonith property from all controller nodes during
upgrade. This is racy and can actually end up disabling stonith after
the upgrade even if when it was enabled.

Let's set the property only from the bootstrap node.

Change-Id: Id4afb867b485ac853be874a0179a7ed7cc914068
Closes-Bug: #1635294
(cherry picked from commit 7ce217909ab0ef1492e20cfc44470aeeaec3a791)

commit_message:
Improve tests with rspec-puppet-facts

This change updates the tests to use rspec-puppet-facts when doing
different OS testing. Additionally as part of this change, there are
improvements to the openstacklib::policycrd testing which uncovered
issues with the verify_contents catalog test. The verify_contents calls
have been replaced with heredocs to better test when multiple services
are excluded.

Change-Id: I86bae2b16026e15b6e4445f3749419b8802bc94d

revisions:

Deprecate the VMware driver's ``wsdl_location`` config option. This
option pointed to the location of the WSDL files required when using
vCenter versions earlier than 5.1. Since the minimum supported version
of vCenter is 5.1, there is no longer a need for this option and its
value is ignored.

Change-Id: Ifc139615320d7f428195292e60f3ae5f54f5fd2f
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate wsdl_location option

Deprecate the VMware driver's ``wsdl_location`` config option. This
option pointed to the location of the WSDL files required when using
vCenter versions earlier than 5.1. Since the minimum supported version
of vCenter is 5.1, there is no longer a need for this option and its
value is ignored.

Change-Id: Ifc139615320d7f428195292e60f3ae5f54f5fd2f

commit_message:
Deprecate iscsi_ip_address, as it is not used

The EMC VNX volume drivers does not use iscsi_ip_address for
anything.

The iscsi_ip_address parameter is deprecated, has no effect
and will be removed in future release.

Change-Id: Ib8705171c4750d2039ff97a616eae9f309db08a0
(cherry picked from commit 68f5a1daf832127d661d01ef98d7a05fd23fd280)

subject: Rename ipv6_utils.is_enabled()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6524, 'name': 'Henry Gessau', 'email': 'HenryG@gessau.net', 'username': 'gessau'}, {'_account_id': 7448, 'name': 'Carl Baldwin', 'email': 'carl@ecbaldwin.net', 'username': 'carl-baldwin'}, {'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10558, 'name': 'Dustin Lundquist', 'email': 'dustin@null-ptr.net', 'username': 'dlundquist'}, {'_account_id': 10980, 'name': 'Doug Wiegley', 'email': 'dougwig@parkside.io', 'username': 'dougw'}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22220, 'name': 'Anindita Das', 'email': 'anindita.das@utexas.edu', 'username': 'anudas'}, {'_account_id': 22524, 'name': 'Mohit Malik', 'email': 'mohit.malik@intel.com', 'username': 'mmalik4'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-10-26 09:14:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/common/ipv6_utils.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py', 'neutron/services/metering/drivers/iptables/iptables_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/common/test_ipv6_utils.py'], 'message': "Rename ipv6_utils.is_enabled()

IPv6 utils is_enabled() doesn't actually determine if IPv6 is enabled on
the host. It checks if /proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/default/disable_ipv6 is
present and is set to 0. This kernel configuration option controls if
the kernel will automatically assign IPv6 link-local addresses to newly
created network interfaces when their link state changes to up. The
existence of this /proc files does indicate that the Linux kernel has
the ipv6 module loaded or ipv6 was compiled in. Having this /proc file
set to zero does not indicate IPv6 is not available on the system, just
that newly created interfaces will inherit this configuration and will
not have IPv6 addresses bound to them unless the administrator changes
the interfaces specific /proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/$IFACE/disable_ipv6
configuration.

This check was added to Neutron so it could operate with distributions
which didn't load the ipv6 kernel module, preventing errors when
attempting to make IPv6 specific configurations in the iptables firewall
driver and the L3 agent. Removing it would break existing deployments.

Renaming this function to provide clarity for complex conditions tested
by this function. In fact it is a good security practice to set this
default disable_ipv6 option to 1, and explicitly enable IPv6 by setting
disable_ipv6=0 on individual interfaces which the administrator intends
to bind IPv6 addresses on. This establishes parity with IPv4 behavior
where interfaces are not active in an address family until the
administrator explicitly configures them to be active in that address
family. This practice does not currently work as expected with the
Neutron, since setting /proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/default/disable_ipv6 to 1
unexpectedly disables creating IPv6 security group rules leaving
instances completely exposed via IPv6 regardless of security group
rules.

Change-Id: I844b992240a5db642766ec9c04e3b5fcab8e2e23
"}]
commit_message:
Rename ipv6_utils.is_enabled()

IPv6 utils is_enabled() doesn't actually determine if IPv6 is enabled on
the host. It checks if /proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/default/disable_ipv6 is
present and is set to 0. This kernel configuration option controls if
the kernel will automatically assign IPv6 link-local addresses to newly
created network interfaces when their link state changes to up. The
existence of this /proc files does indicate that the Linux kernel has
the ipv6 module loaded or ipv6 was compiled in. Having this /proc file
set to zero does not indicate IPv6 is not available on the system, just
that newly created interfaces will inherit this configuration and will
not have IPv6 addresses bound to them unless the administrator changes
the interfaces specific /proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/$IFACE/disable_ipv6
configuration.

This check was added to Neutron so it could operate with distributions
which didn't load the ipv6 kernel module, preventing errors when
attempting to make IPv6 specific configurations in the iptables firewall
driver and the L3 agent. Removing it would break existing deployments.

Renaming this function to provide clarity for complex conditions tested
by this function. In fact it is a good security practice to set this
default disable_ipv6 option to 1, and explicitly enable IPv6 by setting
disable_ipv6=0 on individual interfaces which the administrator intends
to bind IPv6 addresses on. This establishes parity with IPv4 behavior
where interfaces are not active in an address family until the
administrator explicitly configures them to be active in that address
family. This practice does not currently work as expected with the
Neutron, since setting /proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/default/disable_ipv6 to 1
unexpectedly disables creating IPv6 security group rules leaving
instances completely exposed via IPv6 regardless of security group
rules.

Change-Id: I844b992240a5db642766ec9c04e3b5fcab8e2e23

subject: rest: fix Epoch timestamp parsing
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-10-12 17:25:29.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/rest/__init__.py', 'gnocchi/tests/gabbi/gabbits/metric.yaml'], 'message': 'rest: fix Epoch timestamp parsing

The recent change in 83f02996556af62d085ecf5bfe240440914fee8f leverages
pandas to convert timestamps, but specifies unit as being nanoseconds.
That broke the use case where the timestamps are sent as float
representing the number of seconds after Epoch, which was supported.

Change-Id: Ic9df7357b7006d2f592232e793ac12136e950f2e
'}]
commit_message:
rest: fix Epoch timestamp parsing

The recent change in 83f02996556af62d085ecf5bfe240440914fee8f leverages
pandas to convert timestamps, but specifies unit as being nanoseconds.
That broke the use case where the timestamps are sent as float
representing the number of seconds after Epoch, which was supported.

Change-Id: Ic9df7357b7006d2f592232e793ac12136e950f2e

commit_message:
[WIP] Allow specifying a maximum time allowed per clean step

This adds the ability to specify a "timeout" field in agent clean steps.
Clean steps with this parameter will fail out if the step takes longer
than "timeout" seconds.

Change-Id: I804b2315ab14d56a4426055b3eee35b255dad414
Closes-Bug: #1611137

Change-Id: Ie2b2dd35d64df76d214991c17d30d7af6455ee2a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 31a2c9da0e5d1159d7fdaecc0743fd945c7a1b02)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure lxc_hosts have updated facts before container creation

This change adds a quick fact gather on lxc_hosts prior to creating the
containers. This was added because lxc-container-create will fail should
the facts be missing or stale.

Change-Id: Ie2b2dd35d64df76d214991c17d30d7af6455ee2a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 31a2c9da0e5d1159d7fdaecc0743fd945c7a1b02)

commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example).
To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

commit_message:
Fix warning when running tox -e docs

*WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
  cmd: /bin/rm
  env: /home/python-mistralclient/.tox/docs
Maybe you forgot to specify a dependency? See also the
whitelist_externals envconfig setting.
*WARNING: html_static_path entry
u'/home/python-mistralclient/doc/source/_static' does not exist

Change-Id: Ie2757407b79649cfb1a799fbb0d050e294ceacfc

subject: Resolve random node selection in repo build
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-27 15:10:05.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/repo-build.yml'], 'message': 'Resolve random node selection in repo build

In some cases the multiple architecture support in a multi-node cloud
will select nodes incapable of sync'ing data outside of themselves as
primary build targets. This patch ensures that a known group of
"repo_nodes" is created at run-time and consists of unique hosts with
unique architectures, provided the hostname does not match the first
node within the "repo_all" group.

Closes-Bug: #1633784
Change-Id: Ifdfabf3b2ef147d287263f2c79c676267fbdea3c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit cf0d302d56df810ad47b105d3ccbd3601069144e)
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve random node selection in repo build

In some cases the multiple architecture support in a multi-node cloud
will select nodes incapable of sync'ing data outside of themselves as
primary build targets. This patch ensures that a known group of
"repo_nodes" is created at run-time and consists of unique hosts with
unique architectures, provided the hostname does not match the first
node within the "repo_all" group.

Closes-Bug: #1633784
Change-Id: Ifdfabf3b2ef147d287263f2c79c676267fbdea3c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit cf0d302d56df810ad47b105d3ccbd3601069144e)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-27 13:01:22.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/add-rpc-tunables-cfb2027b083ccf88.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'templates/cinder.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Add remote procedure call tunables to cinder

This allows us to override the default settings, which is useful for
large deployments or deploying a large number of cinder volumes at
once where backend response times are slowed down.

Change-Id: Ibd69473c8d66decea17daad5ce9a5f9e499d7779
Closes-Bug: #1617040
(cherry picked from commit 5fab05666e81411661c3b6f1f82524c2a3e0d1dd)
'}]
commit_message:
Add remote procedure call tunables to cinder

This allows us to override the default settings, which is useful for
large deployments or deploying a large number of cinder volumes at
once where backend response times are slowed down.

Change-Id: Ibd69473c8d66decea17daad5ce9a5f9e499d7779
Closes-Bug: #1617040
(cherry picked from commit 5fab05666e81411661c3b6f1f82524c2a3e0d1dd)

commit_message:
Add --long option and more columns to the hypervisor list command

Support --long option and more columns in output of hypervisor
list command, including 'Hypervisor Type', 'Host IP', 'State',
and 'vCPU Used', 'vCPUs', 'Memory MB Used', 'Memory MB' with
--long option.

Change-Id: I0c790c7835309dded03e230cf497168e19404537
Closes-Bug: #1637074

commit_message:
Remove os-client-config hacks for 1.19.x and 1.20.x

os-client-config is fixing the _validate_auth() issues, we don't
need to anymore.  No back-compat is required, only OSC ever expected
this and that version was never released.

Change-Id: Ic0f2887a4aa18c313692850cf624101f9f7cdefb

commit_message:
Fix unit tests for newest GitPython

This patch fixes the two problems introduced with the latest version
of GitPython (namely 2.0.9).

The GitCommandNotFound exception now requires two new arguments,
'command' and 'cause'. And the 'command' parameter requires a
non-empty string.

Change-Id: Icf95ac057cc4df3c56da81c7d0a1ec2fd2104bf1
Closes-Bug: #1637143

subject: Fix MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT for systemd
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-27 14:32:51.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_post_install.yml'], 'message': 'Fix MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT for systemd

The /etc/default/mysql file needs to be sourced for systemd to start
mysql with the appropriate MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT value.

We are already adding the line to source the /etc/default/mysql file in
the init.d/mysql script, but we were skipping dropping the defaults file
when using "systemd".

Additionally, this groups the init file change and the default file
templating to be sequential.

Change-Id: If5dc328e67bde9d84f40c2b192c217e82e1987eb
Closes-Bug: #1634562
(cherry picked from commit 9a8fced0f214734f2de28e8178e06a04ce2235f7)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT for systemd

The /etc/default/mysql file needs to be sourced for systemd to start
mysql with the appropriate MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT value.

We are already adding the line to source the /etc/default/mysql file in
the init.d/mysql script, but we were skipping dropping the defaults file
when using "systemd".

Additionally, this groups the init file change and the default file
templating to be sequential.

Change-Id: If5dc328e67bde9d84f40c2b192c217e82e1987eb
Closes-Bug: #1634562
(cherry picked from commit 9a8fced0f214734f2de28e8178e06a04ce2235f7)

commit_message:
Add extra logging to bridge mapping updates

Add debug logs for when the agent reports updated bridge mappings back
to neutron.  If a vNIC gets deployed on backing devices with the wrong
label (physical network name), these logs help figure out why.

Change-Id: I955a58b4da264dc5d7b38bc7d821a311363cdfcf

subject: Ensure that upper constraints are always applied
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-22 07:25:16.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/common-tasks/set-upper-constraints.yml', 'playbooks/lxc-hosts-setup.yml', 'playbooks/repo-build.yml', 'playbooks/unbound-install.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml', 'playbooks/repo-server.yml'], 'message': "Ensure that upper constraints are always applied

When the upper constraints are not applied, the resulting
build for the same tag may be different from one day to
the next. This results in an inconsistent experience for
deployers.

This patch sets the upper constraints to be used by the
following:
- https://review.openstack.org/388159 (lxc hosts)
- https://review.openstack.org/388072 (pip install)
- https://review.openstack.org/388230 (keystone install)
  This is a pattern to establish across other roles.

As some pip installs happen before the repo server is up
a common set of tasks is added to a few of the plays to
verify if there is a local copy of constraints available.
If not it will then source the upstream constraints based
on the OpenStack requirements SHA that's been pinned.

Change-Id: I7ddd44be30c610609c1429147646dcb1d3e6ca59
(cherry picked from commit 46258cc435a67fdf4e089111984ff7ae6930ffa7)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that upper constraints are always applied

When the upper constraints are not applied, the resulting
build for the same tag may be different from one day to
the next. This results in an inconsistent experience for
deployers.

This patch sets the upper constraints to be used by the
following:
- https://review.openstack.org/388159 (lxc hosts)
- https://review.openstack.org/388072 (pip install)
- https://review.openstack.org/388230 (keystone install)
  This is a pattern to establish across other roles.

As some pip installs happen before the repo server is up
a common set of tasks is added to a few of the plays to
verify if there is a local copy of constraints available.
If not it will then source the upstream constraints based
on the OpenStack requirements SHA that's been pinned.

Change-Id: I7ddd44be30c610609c1429147646dcb1d3e6ca59
(cherry picked from commit 46258cc435a67fdf4e089111984ff7ae6930ffa7)

subject: Add the ability to ignore requirements from a given package
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-27 06:06:33.000000000', 'files': ['lookup/py_pkgs.py'], 'message': 'Add the ability to ignore requirements from a given package

Some packages simply do not play well with others. One such case is
"tempest" where time and time again it's unbound requirements break
everything. This change allows the package indexer to examine remote
repos and exclude packages from the global package building list by
using the metadata value ``ignorerequirements=True``. When a package is
ignored it can still be built within in a venv or used by referencing
the git repos however it will no longer be part of the global wheel
building package list.

Change-Id: Iacf15eea14a2cd9c98bbb59d99e2a1ea94bd0a5b
Closes-Bug: #1631992
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add the ability to ignore requirements from a given package

Some packages simply do not play well with others. One such case is
"tempest" where time and time again it's unbound requirements break
everything. This change allows the package indexer to examine remote
repos and exclude packages from the global package building list by
using the metadata value ``ignorerequirements=True``. When a package is
ignored it can still be built within in a venv or used by referencing
the git repos however it will no longer be part of the global wheel
building package list.

Change-Id: Iacf15eea14a2cd9c98bbb59d99e2a1ea94bd0a5b
Closes-Bug: #1631992
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Make 'module' directives match filenames
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-25 20:07:49.000000000', 'files': ['elements/selinux/custom-policies/tripleo-selinux-rabbitmq.te', 'elements/selinux/custom-policies/tripleo-selinux-mariadb.te'], 'message': "Make 'module' directives match filenames

As of the following upstream commit to checkpolicy, compiling
policy modules with filenames which differ from the module
directive will fail:

https://github.com/SELinuxProject/selinux/commit/c6acfae4bc22586ad1dc259b0aad57fa6c5b43ef

This patch makes the policy filenames match the module directive
in the policy file, resolving the issue.

Change-Id: I5730bc51658bb886eacedd8af2c6251e1f8387f5
Closes-bug: 1636613
Signed-off-by: Lon Hohberger <lhh@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Make 'module' directives match filenames

As of the following upstream commit to checkpolicy, compiling
policy modules with filenames which differ from the module
directive will fail:

https://github.com/SELinuxProject/selinux/commit/c6acfae4bc22586ad1dc259b0aad57fa6c5b43ef

This patch makes the policy filenames match the module directive
in the policy file, resolving the issue.

Change-Id: I5730bc51658bb886eacedd8af2c6251e1f8387f5
Closes-bug: 1636613
Signed-off-by: Lon Hohberger <lhh@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ensure all HostsDeployments finish before puppet

This makes sure that the Host settings for all deployments are finished
before starting the AllNodesDeployments which execute puppet.

Change-Id: Ibe604472255ce905ca2c1dca2a9b07a6f8f40e47
Related-bug: #1633565
(cherry picked from commit ccc3a569833ce13c472d48815eaeb153ec650b54)

subject: Fix AdminPassword for overcloud during upgrades
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-27 14:02:10.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix AdminPassword for overcloud during upgrades

In newton the password generation moved to a workflow.  In the case
when an overcloud is upgraded from mitaka to newton, the previous
OS_PASSWORD/AdminPassword should be respected if found in the
environment.

This is a one cycle fix that should be immediately considered
as deprecated and will be removed in ocata as upgrades from
newton to ocata should both use the password generation workflow.

Change-Id: I05dbbe61f3ff8da182739aa41512b76fc86cb7a6
backport: newton
'}]
commit_message:
Fix AdminPassword for overcloud during upgrades

In newton the password generation moved to a workflow.  In the case
when an overcloud is upgraded from mitaka to newton, the previous
OS_PASSWORD/AdminPassword should be respected if found in the
environment.

This is a one cycle fix that should be immediately considered
as deprecated and will be removed in ocata as upgrades from
newton to ocata should both use the password generation workflow.

Change-Id: I05dbbe61f3ff8da182739aa41512b76fc86cb7a6
backport: newton

commit_message:
Ensure lxc_hosts have updated facts before container creation

This change adds a quick fact gather on lxc_hosts prior to creating the
containers. This was added because lxc-container-create will fail should
the facts be missing or stale.

Change-Id: Ie2b2dd35d64df76d214991c17d30d7af6455ee2a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Set owner of drive-audit recon cache to swift user
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16896, 'name': 'Ondřej Nový', 'email': 'novy@ondrej.org', 'username': 'onovy'}, {'_account_id': 20508, 'name': 'Mohit Motiani', 'email': 'mohit.motiani@intel.com', 'username': 'mohit.motiani'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-10-19 17:16:56.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'bin/swift-drive-audit', 'etc/drive-audit.conf-sample', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'doc/source/admin_guide.rst'], 'message': 'Set owner of drive-audit recon cache to swift user

Fixies this problem:
* swift-drive-audit needs to be run by root, because only root have
  "umount" permission
* swift-object servers typically runs as user swift
* if swift-drive-audit is run by root, /var/cache/swift/drive.recon is
  owned by root, with 0o600
* recon middleware (inside swift-object-server) can't read this cache
  file: swift-object: Error reading recon cache file

This patch adds "user" option to drive-audit config file. Recon cache
is chowned to this user.

Change-Id: Ibf20543ee690b7c5a37fabd1540fd5c0c7b638c9
'}]
commit_message:
Set owner of drive-audit recon cache to swift user

Fixies this problem:
* swift-drive-audit needs to be run by root, because only root have
  "umount" permission
* swift-object servers typically runs as user swift
* if swift-drive-audit is run by root, /var/cache/swift/drive.recon is
  owned by root, with 0o600
* recon middleware (inside swift-object-server) can't read this cache
  file: swift-object: Error reading recon cache file

This patch adds "user" option to drive-audit config file. Recon cache
is chowned to this user.

Change-Id: Ibf20543ee690b7c5a37fabd1540fd5c0c7b638c9

commit_message:
Add remote procedure call tunables to cinder

This allows us to override the default settings, which is useful for
large deployments or deploying a large number of cinder volumes at
once where backend response times are slowed down.

Change-Id: Ibd69473c8d66decea17daad5ce9a5f9e499d7779
Closes-Bug: #1617040

commit_message:
Lvm: add create_from_image & create_from_func

In subsequent commits, these new methods will replace the calls to
Image.cache() in libvirt/driver.py, and allow us to delete the
create_image() implementations from each image backend.

Change-Id: I388e12d1adfd5555dd636c147378dc9fdb911566
Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Booth <mbooth@redhat.com>

subject: Convert boolean parameters in host api
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-27 09:38:42.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/ha/api.py', 'masakari/tests/unit/ha/test_api.py'], 'message': 'Convert boolean parameters in host api

Host create and update api's 'on_maintenance' and 'reserved'
boolean attributes needs to be converted to boolean before
inserting into database otherwise it stores them as 'True'
as user could pass these parameters as string 'Yes' or 'YES'
or "True" etc.

Closes-Bug: #1635608

Change-Id: If22a25b710f4d3d485c0d0e5bf4058b07060c8bd
'}]
commit_message:
Convert boolean parameters in host api

Host create and update api's 'on_maintenance' and 'reserved'
boolean attributes needs to be converted to boolean before
inserting into database otherwise it stores them as 'True'
as user could pass these parameters as string 'Yes' or 'YES'
or "True" etc.

Closes-Bug: #1635608

Change-Id: If22a25b710f4d3d485c0d0e5bf4058b07060c8bd

commit_message:
Use release number from spec instead of 1

During Fuel RPM build, release from spec is ignored and 1 is used
instead. With this change it will be used in final release string.

Change-Id: I402f2425dd9fc0b11b9b4e21d5762b3c1064abd7

commit_message:
Fix rpmdb errors while sandbox creation

Numerous rpmdb error might occure while creating sandbox

  error: rpmdb: BDB2034 unable to allocate memory for mutex; resize mutex region

This commit fixes them.

Change-Id: I34b64b8d9e1a9df7eab443fe5017ad8fc59463d2

subject: [IGNORE] Allow to disable docker from kernel args
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-28 13:40:18.000000000', 'files': ['iso/bootstrap_admin_node.sh'], 'message': "[IGNORE] Allow to disable docker from kernel args

For some reason docker couldn't be started if (and only if)
fuel-menu was run before, and it's config (even without any
modifications) was saved. There is a bug related:

  https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1593207

This commit is a workaround to not start docker service.

Add 'startdocker=no' to boot string.

Change-Id: Ic99b89c6a5d4399e22cff498a7aa54bce71dd88f
blueprint: mos-xenial
"}]
commit_message:
[IGNORE] Allow to disable docker from kernel args

For some reason docker couldn't be started if (and only if)
fuel-menu was run before, and it's config (even without any
modifications) was saved. There is a bug related:

  https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1593207

This commit is a workaround to not start docker service.

Add 'startdocker=no' to boot string.

Change-Id: Ic99b89c6a5d4399e22cff498a7aa54bce71dd88f
blueprint: mos-xenial

subject: Block oslo.config 3.18.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-26 09:13:46.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Block oslo.config 3.18.0

There is a issue with tuples that was causing
ocatavia (and others to have issues with this new
release).

Since this is summit week and new releases aren't
being recommended (since they may destabalize things)
we are just going to block 3.18.0 until we can further
release a patched version (a fix has merged).

Change-Id: Ib902d57a8d5c49271b931fe8f18ec6f90159fe97
Related-Bug: #1635717
"}]
commit_message:
Block oslo.config 3.18.0

There is a issue with tuples that was causing
ocatavia (and others to have issues with this new
release).

Since this is summit week and new releases aren't
being recommended (since they may destabalize things)
we are just going to block 3.18.0 until we can further
release a patched version (a fix has merged).

Change-Id: Ib902d57a8d5c49271b931fe8f18ec6f90159fe97

commit_message:
Make build_requests.instance MediumText

The build_requests.instance column is a serialized
instance object, and the instances.user_data column
is MediumText, so the build_requests.instance column
itself needs to be at least MediumText in size for MySQL.

Change-Id: I7d65df37c02750593037744543ad15e5bc64e913
Closes-Bug: #1635446

Since the order in which we receive the allowed address pair doesn't
matter, we should remove the order/sequence dependency in
_update_port_with_address method. The proposed solution is to assert

commit_message:
Restriction on sequence of allowed address pairs

Since the order in which we receive the allowed address pair doesn't
matter, we should remove the order/sequence dependency in
_update_port_with_address method. The proposed solution is to assert
on the items in the allowed address pairs.

Closes-Bug: #1594571
Change-Id: Ib8c219e8230fef5c51534c131b40d2165467b078

commit_message:
TrivialFix: Remove default=None when set value in Config

By default oslo.cfg sets the default values as None [1], There is
no need to explicitly do this.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/master/oslo_config/cfg.py#L829

Change-Id: Ibb74f1fedd1c20d97846308f30cb17dbcc1f6aba

subject: Fix the rabbitmq/redis pacemaker resource timeouts on updates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-26 16:11:59.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': 'Fix the rabbitmq/redis pacemaker resource timeouts on updates

With the following two changes we increased the timeout for redis and
rabbit for both starting and stopping to 200s:
https://review.openstack.org/386618 newton (merged)
https://review.openstack.org/385555 master (merged)

We want to also fix that on minor updates on all our supported
releases upstream and downstream (newton, mitaka, liberty, kilo).
This way we can guarantee that we have a uniform timeout for
sart and stop for rabbit and redis across all our releases.

Change-Id: If59bf3386832ee78d3a654f01077aff2e8be76e8
Closes-Bug: #1634851
(cherry picked from commit 38664900523ae0cdd346d4c66395b8fd0184b03a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the rabbitmq/redis pacemaker resource timeouts on updates

With the following two changes we increased the timeout for redis and
rabbit for both starting and stopping to 200s:
https://review.openstack.org/386618 newton (merged)
https://review.openstack.org/385555 master (merged)

We want to also fix that on minor updates on all our supported
releases upstream and downstream (newton, mitaka, liberty, kilo).
This way we can guarantee that we have a uniform timeout for
sart and stop for rabbit and redis across all our releases.

Change-Id: If59bf3386832ee78d3a654f01077aff2e8be76e8
Closes-Bug: #1634851
(cherry picked from commit 38664900523ae0cdd346d4c66395b8fd0184b03a)

subject: Fix consuming from unbound reply queue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 13:19:41.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': 'Fix consuming from unbound reply queue

Consumer declaration consist of the next steps:
  1) declare an exchange
  2) declare a queue
  3) bind the queue to the exchange

Due to reply exchanges are auto-delete, at the
step 3 the exchange can be removed and consumer.declare()
will raise `queue.bind 404 Exchange not found`.

So, in this case the queue is exist and AMQPListener
just call consumer.consume() on the queue and go to
drain_events() despite on the fact that the queue is
unbound.

This change tries to redeclare queue/exchange proactively
each times channel change and just before consuming messages.

Co-Authored-By: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1609766
Change-Id: Id8b48df3d26675d72955d417ce7622b1e8aa6195
(cherry picked from commit 3f4ce9470b3f9e0502f61345a6943adad2dadac9)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix consuming from unbound reply queue

Consumer declaration consist of the next steps:
  1) declare an exchange
  2) declare a queue
  3) bind the queue to the exchange

Due to reply exchanges are auto-delete, at the
step 3 the exchange can be removed and consumer.declare()
will raise `queue.bind 404 Exchange not found`.

So, in this case the queue is exist and AMQPListener
just call consumer.consume() on the queue and go to
drain_events() despite on the fact that the queue is
unbound.

This change tries to redeclare queue/exchange proactively
each times channel change and just before consuming messages.

Co-Authored-By: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1609766
Change-Id: Id8b48df3d26675d72955d417ce7622b1e8aa6195
(cherry picked from commit 3f4ce9470b3f9e0502f61345a6943adad2dadac9)

subject: Fix X-User and X-Tenant deprecated headers in from_environ
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 23:19:15.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_context/tests/test_context.py', 'oslo_context/context.py'], 'message': "Fix X-User and X-Tenant deprecated headers in from_environ

The X-User and X-Tenant deprecated headers from auth_token middleware
are actually name values, not ID values. In most cases this doesn't
matter because these are deprecated and only used when no newer headers
are available but we should still fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1614776
Change-Id: I16e80671e853387004434e766dd6ceebe0a6b2a6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix X-User and X-Tenant deprecated headers in from_environ

The X-User and X-Tenant deprecated headers from auth_token middleware
are actually name values, not ID values. In most cases this doesn't
matter because these are deprecated and only used when no newer headers
are available but we should still fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1614776
Change-Id: I16e80671e853387004434e766dd6ceebe0a6b2a6

subject: Fix passphrase passing to asymmetric key order for Barbican
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 11:02:55.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/barbican/order.py'], 'message': "Fix passphrase passing to asymmetric key order for Barbican

The asymetric key order constructor in barbican takes the parameter
passphrase instead of 'pass_phrase' which is the actual json value
that's passed. This was causing the heat resource to be unable to
provision such orders with that parameter.

Change-Id: I15e104b1236a4386a440aaae723544e971f09ff6
Closes-Bug: #1635213
"}]
commit_message:
Fix passphrase passing to asymmetric key order for Barbican

The asymetric key order constructor in barbican takes the parameter
passphrase instead of 'pass_phrase' which is the actual json value
that's passed. This was causing the heat resource to be unable to
provision such orders with that parameter.

Change-Id: I15e104b1236a4386a440aaae723544e971f09ff6
Closes-Bug: #1635213

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14384, 'name': 'Quobyte OpenStack CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci-external@quobyte.com', 'username': 'quobyteci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20227, 'name': 'donggr', 'email': 'donggr@awcloud.com', 'username': 'donggr'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-15 14:22:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_utils.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py'], 'message': "Catch error and log warning when not able to update mtimes

When we launch an instance, nova updates the mtime for the _base image
to let the image cache manager know the image is actively used.  This
can lead to unexpected I/O errors when launching a large amount of
instances at once coming from the same _base image.

This commit puts the execute call in a try, except block to catch
possible errors. It also logs a warning with the path and error message.
With this, at least once the update will succeed.

Closes-Bug: #1621818

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I2fd1700aa4563a906eb574cbbe16caa63abae0d6
Signed-off-by: Joris S'heeren <joris.sheeren@combellgroup.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Catch error and log warning when not able to update mtimes

When we launch an instance, nova updates the mtime for the _base image
to let the image cache manager know the image is actively used.  This
can lead to unexpected I/O errors when launching a large amount of
instances at once coming from the same _base image.

This commit puts the execute call in a try, except block to catch
possible errors. It also logs a warning with the path and error message.
With this, at least once the update will succeed.

Closes-Bug: #1621818

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I2fd1700aa4563a906eb574cbbe16caa63abae0d6
Signed-off-by: Joris S'heeren <joris.sheeren@combellgroup.com>

commit_message:
secgroup: default secgroup rules need to be created on ODL

When security group is created, corresponding default security group
rules are also created. But there is no corresponding callbacks. So
when security group is created, the special logic to create security
group rules need to be created on ODL.
The modification to v2 driver is a sort of bug work around until the
patch [1] is needed for v2 driver.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281693/

Change-Id: I7305d6c970f352bde0111a9a9fe6612bae1ebd5f

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-14 21:20:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': 'Eliminate resource tracker to host manager races

For a new ComputeNode the nova resource manager first creates the
ComputeNode with the basic resource information, and then does further
resource processing updating the ComputeNode with more information such
as the free_disk_gb, then saves the ComputeNode. If the nova scheduler
picks up this new ComputeNode during the period between the create and
the save, then it will try to run _update_from_compute_node with
required pieces of information missing.

This patch moves the logic in the nova resource tracker that creates
the ComputeNode, to a point after the all the resource processing for
the ComputeNode is done. This makes sure that the schedular will not
pick up the new ComputeNode before the all the processing and resource
information is populated on the node.

Change-Id: Icbc1aae6344e870749891883ad125551c78c115d
Closes-Bug: #1567434
'}]
commit_message:
Eliminate resource tracker to host manager races

For a new ComputeNode the nova resource manager first creates the
ComputeNode with the basic resource information, and then does further
resource processing updating the ComputeNode with more information such
as the free_disk_gb, then saves the ComputeNode. If the nova scheduler
picks up this new ComputeNode during the period between the create and
the save, then it will try to run _update_from_compute_node with
required pieces of information missing.

This patch moves the logic in the nova resource tracker that creates
the ComputeNode, to a point after the all the resource processing for
the ComputeNode is done. This makes sure that the schedular will not
pick up the new ComputeNode before the all the processing and resource
information is populated on the node.

Change-Id: Icbc1aae6344e870749891883ad125551c78c115d
Closes-Bug: #1567434

commit_message:
The changes prevent nova image-show 500 Error

Added logic to update function call to return
size of image as None if the glance doesn't return size
which occurs when image is in saving state.
Added testcases for the same.

Change-Id: I41371649482cd27b1dd0b9e230af38291b7d439c
Closes-Bug: #1569122

commit_message:
Objects: add limits, reservations and shares to ImageMetaProps object

This enables a user to set quotas. More specifically limitations,
reservations and shares for the following:
    - cpu
    - memory
    - disk
    - vif

For limits the utilization will not exceed the limit.
Reservations will be guaranteed for the instance.
Shares are used to determine relative allocation between resource consumers.
In general, a consumer with more shares gets proportionally more of the
resource, subject to certain other constraints.

DocImpact

This is part of the blueprint vmware-limits-newton
Change-Id: I3a06843a210baed00f13cd0c4dfb22e77b91768f

commit_message:
VMware: support limits via image meta data

The driver now behaves like all other drivers, that is, the limits
are able to be configured via glance image metadata.

DocImpact
 - All of the quota:* key limits should be quota_* keys in the
   glance metadata

This completes the blueprint vmware-limits-newton

Change-Id: I5e955ec7da038dff54f00b2534667a5d69b7d9f3

commit_message:
libvirt: Add create_from_image & create_from_func for Qcow2

These new methods replace the shim implementation which calls
Image.cache() and Qcow2.create_image().

Change-Id: Id6e1fa687b4414686c7ec7a22b0394713054a3bf
Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Booth <mbooth@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-01 16:01:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Don't create ephemerals or swap in _create_image

_create_image has only 2 remainining callers: spawn and rescue. Only
spawn requires the creation of ephemeral and swap disks, so we move
this functionality into spawn. Similarly, on spawn expects the
instance directory to not exist, so we move instance directory
creation into spawn.

As the remaining functionality of _create_image is now quite
different, we rename it, and take the opportunity to cleanup its
arguments. Also note that as neither of the remaining callers are
involved in a migration, the fallback functionality is no longer
relevant.

The test churn in this change reflects the above changes:

test_create_image_initrd renamed to test_create_and_inject_with_initrd
and moved to be with the other create_and_inject tests.

test_create_image_with_swap is no longer relevant, removed without
replacement.

test_create_image_not_exist_fallback is no longer relevant, removed
without replacement.

test_create_image_not_exist_no_fallback refactored to be
test_create_and_inject_not_found.

Change-Id: Ia3a15ad92c028b72989f26e8fcf742a2a5de7b17
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Don't create ephemerals or swap in _create_image

_create_image has only 2 remainining callers: spawn and rescue. Only
spawn requires the creation of ephemeral and swap disks, so we move
this functionality into spawn. Similarly, on spawn expects the
instance directory to not exist, so we move instance directory
creation into spawn.

As the remaining functionality of _create_image is now quite
different, we rename it, and take the opportunity to cleanup its
arguments. Also note that as neither of the remaining callers are
involved in a migration, the fallback functionality is no longer
relevant.

The test churn in this change reflects the above changes:

test_create_image_initrd renamed to test_create_and_inject_with_initrd
and moved to be with the other create_and_inject tests.

test_create_image_with_swap is no longer relevant, removed without
replacement.

test_create_image_not_exist_fallback is no longer relevant, removed
without replacement.

test_create_image_not_exist_no_fallback refactored to be
test_create_and_inject_not_found.

Change-Id: Ia3a15ad92c028b72989f26e8fcf742a2a5de7b17

commit_message:
Add charm-manila-generic and interface

This patchset adds the charm-manila-generic which is to configure the
manila charm to use the generic interface.  The
charm-interface-manila-plugin which connects backend configuration
charms to manila.

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-23 05:50:34.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix Newton branch regex for some releasenotes

Change I3d2007f053d2a8fd62b1d183b7747ea66d42d949 updated the branch
regex to include newton - but the repo updated in that change
(python-tripleoclient) is not part of the branch condition.

This follows the second changeset of

Change-Id: I87179e2d547421bc85fbf2a2abff233e467f2180

commit_message:
Fix Newton branch regex for some releasenotes

Change I3d2007f053d2a8fd62b1d183b7747ea66d42d949 updated the branch
regex to include newton - but the repo updated in that change
(python-tripleoclient) is not part of the branch condition.

The change of the branch regex is wrong and not mentioned in commit
message. Revert it. This is also in accordance with the commit message.

Instead add a new branch regex for releasenotes starting with Ocata.
This follows the second changeset of
I3d2007f053d2a8fd62b1d183b7747ea66d42d949.

Change-Id: I87179e2d547421bc85fbf2a2abff233e467f2180

commit_message:
switch to python-db-jobs and delete python35-jobs

molteniron uses a mysql database so the gate needs to be configured
as using a database.

Also, molteniron is currently only Python 2.7 enabled so don't
check for 3.5 yet.

Change-Id: If35b8dc3da7c9674f2c0a1a01e1b555b4fd7960f

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-25 13:46:33.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/pacemaker/database/redis.pp'], 'message': 'Set redis file descriptor limit when run via pacemaker

The current redis file descriptor limit is 4096 because of two reasons:
- It is run via the redis user
- It is not started via systemd which has explicit LimitNOFILE set to
  10240 (which matches the default configuration of maximum 10000
  clients)

Create an /etc/security/limits.d/redis.conf file in order to increase
the fd limit value  With this change we correctly get the following
limits:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# pcs status |grep -A2 redis
 Master/Slave Set: redis-master [redis]
     Masters: [ overcloud-controller-2 ]
     Slaves: [ overcloud-controller-0 overcloud-controller-1 ]

[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# cat /proc/`pgrep redis`/limits | grep open
Max open files            10240                10240   files

Previously this limit was set to 4096.

Change-Id: I7691581bad92ad9442cecd82cf44f5ac78ed169f
Closes-Bug: #1635334
'}]
commit_message:
Set redis file descriptor limit when run via pacemaker

The current redis file descriptor limit is 4096 because of two reasons:
- It is run via the redis user
- It is not started via systemd which has explicit LimitNOFILE set to
  10240 (which matches the default configuration of maximum 10000
  clients)

Create an /etc/security/limits.d/redis.conf file in order to increase
the fd limit value  With this change we correctly get the following
limits:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# pcs status |grep -A2 redis
 Master/Slave Set: redis-master [redis]
     Masters: [ overcloud-controller-2 ]
     Slaves: [ overcloud-controller-0 overcloud-controller-1 ]

[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# cat /proc/`pgrep redis`/limits | grep open
Max open files            10240                10240   files

Previously this limit was set to 4096.

Change-Id: I7691581bad92ad9442cecd82cf44f5ac78ed169f
Closes-Bug: #1635334
